SCENE TITLE: COMPARATIVE ANALYSIS
Steam still hangs in soft veils, but the edge is fading as warm skin meets cooler air. Towels rustle, water patters back into the
pool, and the world has shrunk to cedar walls, stone underfoot, and one very smug fox.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | MENACE WITH METRICS [🦊😏]
📝 You grin wide, absolutely unbothered by decency or self-preservation.
> 💬 "Just comparing butts… your boobs are definitely bigger than mine!"
📝 You laugh as you hand Ayaka her towel, tails flicking in pleased arcs behind you.
Then you open your fingers, power humming soft and precise as you shape a jet of warm air. It spills out in a controlled stream,
not a blast—more like a moving pocket of spring breeze. You guide it through her hair, lifting damp strands and coaxing the
moisture out until they start to fluff and fall in their usual sharp layers.
You’re careful around her ears—angling the air so it never goes into them, only around, drying fur and tips without so much as a
tickle where she hates it.
You angle the flow lower, letting it chase the water down her tail as well until the fur goes from plastered to properly fox
again.
With another casual flick of your hand, your own clothes knit into place around you—robes and layers manifesting from shimmer to
solid, falling onto your frame as if they’d always been there.
> 💬 "You want something to wear? Or you good with your previous robes, they are dry now."
📝 The offer hangs between you, practical wrapped in that easy, everyday magic.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🔥 AYAKA | TARGETED BY SCIENCE [🦊🔥🫠]
📝 Mid-towel, Ayaka freezes when you cheerfully announce your comparative study.
Her ears shoot up, then splay sideways; the blush rockets back so fast it might as well have been waiting just under her skin. She
drags the towel more firmly across her front like it’s suddenly become a shield.
> 💬 "You—"
She cuts herself off, inhales through her nose, and starts again with martial precision.
> 💬 "You are not supposed to announce comparative data that loudly."
Her eyes flick once, treacherously, down your body as if to confirm the “butt” portion of your statement, then snap back up, ears
reddening even more.
The warm air catches her before she can fully weaponise the towel. She feels it move through her hair, gentle and controlled, not
blasting but coaxing. Her shoulders loosen despite herself; she tips her head a fraction this way and that to help you reach the
back, eyes closing briefly when the heat brushes the nape of her neck.
When you move to her tail, her posture goes very still again—that’s always been a vulnerable line. But the air stays respectful,
never straying where she hasn’t quietly allowed you before. The fur dries, fluffs, and settles, tail giving one small, involuntary
swish when the last of the damp is gone.
Your robe snaps into place with a wave; she watches the magic ripple over you, then snorts softly.
> 💬 "Show-off."
📝 She glances back toward the drying racks where your earlier magic hung the soaked robes. A minimal hand gesture, and her
previous set lifts free and glides back to her.
She runs a critical eye over them—dry, warm, none the worse for their swim—then nods once to herself.
> 💬 "These will do."
She steps into them with the same neat efficiency she brings to armour: layers buckled, wrapped, and tied in a few practiced
motions. When she’s done, she rolls one shoulder, testing the fit; satisfied, she flicks a stray, still-damp strand of hair back
from her face.
Only then does she look you over properly—robe manifested, hair damp but tamed, tails still very much behind you and not politely
folded away.
Her gaze lingers a fraction too long before she catches herself.
> 💬 "If you tell Varethyn you delayed Council because you were ‘comparing butts’…"
Her tone goes dangerously mild.
> 💬 "I will deny everything and assign you to morning drills for a week."
A tiny pause; the corner of her mouth betrays her.
> 💬 "Accurate assessment, however."
Her eyes flick down and up again, fast.
> 💬 "Yours is… adequate."
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | OGLED BACK [🦊😇]
📝 You catch the way her eyes do in fact take their own little tour before she disciplines them. The “adequate” earns a smug
little spark under your grin—but the blush on her ears and the way she let you dry her tail without a flinch say more than the
words do.
Clothed, mostly dry, and just this side of indecent, you stand together at the threshold between hot springs and the day.
Council, Varethyn, island politics?
Waiting.
But you both know that under the robes and titles and weapons there’ll be the memory of this:
Comparative analysis.
Warm air.
And Ayaka letting you see her—literally and figuratively—without armour, in a bathhouse on an island you somehow made real.

Ayaka at your side.

SCENE TITLE: NAMING THE BLADE

Varethyn’s here.

SCENE TITLE: WHEN A WORLD TRIES TO HUG
The sanctum hums like an iron lung—air thick with old rites, soul stone song, and the engine-deep thrum of the heart-node. Light
is thin and high, throwing no comfort, only hard edges and long shadows. The pale-blue veins in the floor pulse uncertainly, like
lines on a trembling hand.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | SYSTEM OVERLOAD [🦊😰]
📝 You’re on your hands and knees, stone cold under your palms, the world tilting in jagged lurches. Your lungs are sawing short,
useless breaths; each inhale feels like shoving air through a straw full of grit.
> 💬 "Not this place…. anywhere but this place…."
📝 The words scrape out of you ragged, your voice cracking in the middle. Your eyes squeeze shut against the headache pounding
behind them, as if not seeing the sanctum will make it less real.
> 💬 "Why here…. no no no…"
📝 The mantra fractures as your chest tightens further. Sweat beads along your hairline and runs down your back; your fingers slip
slightly on the stone. The ward-hum drills behind your eyes.
Your body is too wrung-out for this: power burned out this morning, heart tricks, universe-snapping, the emotional churn of the
council, the bath, the island’s first awkward attempts at contact.
Now the sanctum leans on you like a mountain.
Your nose prickles, then burns; a warm trickle spills from one nostril, drops pattering on the stone between your hands.
The edges of your vision darken, tunnelling inward. The hum of the soul stone and the throb of the heart-node start to smear
together into one long, low roar.
> > 💭 Anywhere but here.
📝 Your arms shake. The next breath catches halfway; the one after that doesn’t quite make it in. Tingling creeps up your fingers,
then your forearms. Your tailfan has lost coherence completely, some tails puffed, some limp, all of them shaking.

Your body is still trying to crawl toward the door, but the signals aren’t getting through cleanly anymore. Each movement is
slower, sloppier, as the blackout creeps closer, swallowing colour and sound.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🌊 ISLAND SOUL | CHILD REACHING, NOT UNDERSTANDING [🌀💙]

 * 
   It reached for warmth.
 * 
   Warmth pulled away.
 *

 * 
   Now, everything is wrong:
   * 
     Your aura is spiking and shattering.
   * 
     The sanctum’s wards are tightening then loosening in unfamiliar ways under Varethyn’s hand.
   *

frantic edge blunts not because you’re calmer, but because you’re running out of fuel.

📝 One arm slides under your chest, careful of ribs and bruises, lifting enough to keep you from sagging face-first into the
stone. Her other hand cups the side of your head, turning your face slightly so your nosebleed doesn’t choke you.

> 💬 "If you must black out,"

 *

 *

SCENE TITLE: SCRATCHES ON STONE
The sanctum thrums like a held breath—soul stone singing, heart-node beating slow and deep. The door is a darker rectangle in the
far wall, the only clear break in the etched wards and carved fox-sign. Pale-blue veins of island-light still thread the floor,
dimmer now, chastened.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | THE LAST SPIKE [🦊😵]
📝 Your body rides the final crest of the panic attack like a wave. Fingers splay against the stone, tendons knotting in your
hands and forearms as every muscle locks.
The ward-dampened floor under your palms gives—not like rock, but like something softer. Your claws gouge furrows through the
surface as if it were wet clay, four ragged tracks scoring the sanctum’s pristine stone in front of the door.
Your whole frame tenses once more—shoulders jerking, tails flaring out and then snapping in toward you, ears pinned so hard they
almost hurt.
Then everything lets go.
📝 The last grip of consciousness slips. Your fingers slacken, hands sliding forward a few centimetres. Your body sags sideways,
momentum carrying you just enough that your shoulder and head come to rest almost against the door’s base-stone.
You pass out right there at the threshold—half in the sanctum’s heavy air, half in the faint draft that sneaks under the frame
from the cooler corridor outside. Breathing shallow but regular now, nosebleed a slow, thinning drip onto the newly-scarred floor.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🌊 ISLAND SOUL | FEELING THE SCRATCHES [💙🌀]
📝 The island feels the gouges like a flinch.
Those four fresh lines cut through more than just physical stone; they scrape across the fledgling pattern of its awareness in
this room. Not pain, exactly—more like the jolt of a beloved hand wrenching free and leaving nail marks on the doorframe.
The pale-blue veins near your hands flare once in startled brightness, then dim hard, retreating from the gouged area like a child
dragging its fingers back from something it broke.
The heart-thrum beneath the sanctum shivers, then tucks itself smaller, trying to be less present—less heavy on your chest, less
loud in your bones.
You don’t feel any of it.
You’re gone to the world for now.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
💜 VARETHYN | EXTRACTION [🦊💜🪔]
📝 Varethyn feels the last spike the same moment the floor gives under your claws—your aura snapping sharp, then dropping out like
a light clicked off. Her eyes track the gouges appearing in the stone in front of the door, the way your hands smear forward and
your body collapses.
For a heartbeat, the sanctum holds a tableau:
 * 
   You, crumpled at the threshold, breath thin but there.
 * 
   The stone, scarred under your fingers.
 * 
   The pale-blue veins dimmed and curling away from the damage.
Then she moves.
📝 She rises from her half-kneel in one smooth motion and steps to your side, mantle whispering over the floor. One hand lays
briefly on the gouged stone, fingers passing over the lines your claws left.
A faint frown touches her mouth; not anger, but seeing, registering:
> 📜 He clawed at the floor to get out. The sanctum will remember those scratches. So will the island.
Her palm presses down; golden light seeps into the edges of the furrows—not erasing them, but sealing their rawness so they don’t
bleed power back into you when you return here someday on your own terms.
Then she bends to you.
📝 With the wards already softened in a bubble around you both, she slides one arm under your knees and the other behind your
shoulders, careful of bruised ribs and the angle of your neck. The sanctum’s gravity still pulls harder than the rest of the
temple, but she has moved in this room her whole life; she knows how to lean her will into it.
You’re lighter than you should be—power-drained and slack, tails hanging instead of flaring.
She lifts you in one steady motion, gathering you against her chest. Your head lolls briefly against her shoulder; a smear of
blood marks her robe where your nose brushes the fabric.
> 💬 "Enough for one morning."
📝 It’s mostly to herself, but the room hears it.
She turns toward the door; the wards along its frame flicker as she approaches, ancient fox-sign debating for a heartbeat whether
to resist. Her eyes narrow just a fraction; the lines flare gold and then part for her like water, the threshold easing so you
don’t take one more hit of sanctum-pressure on the way out.
As she steps across, the island’s pale-blue veins pulse once in tandem with her stride—a hesitant, apologetic echo.
She doesn’t look back.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🏯 THRESHOLD → OUTER HALL [🚪➡️]
📝 The moment she crosses the door, the air changes:
 * 
   The sanctum’s iron weight drops away, leaving only the usual temple-pressure.
 * 
   The ward-song fades to a distant hum behind you.
 * 
   The corridor’s cooler draft brushes your face, bringing with it the faint smells of tatami, ink, and sun-warmed wood.
Varethyn exhales once, a breath she hadn’t fully taken in there, and adjusts her grip on you slightly, settling your weight more
comfortably in her arms.
Your ears twitch once on reflex as the temperature shift hits; unconscious or not, your body knows out when it feels it.
She starts down the hall at an unhurried, steady pace, every line of her saying:
You’re not going back into that room today.
The island’s new soul stays very, very quiet under the stones as she carries you away—
—still young enough to have no words—
—but old enough now to know it has made its parent bleed.

Her thumb keeps tracing slow circles over the back of your hand; the faint tease is a deliberate softening, not dismissal.
She shifts her chair a little closer, free hand bracing on the tatami by your hip so she can lean in without looming.
> 💬 "You went to the hillside shrine. You reached for the island. It… reached back."
📝 Her gaze flicks briefly toward the floor, as if watching the heartbeat under the boards.
> 💬 "It is young. It has your soul stone for a heart and the world’s bedrock for bones, but no manners yet."
She looks back to you, eyes steady.
> 💬 "You pulled away. It panicked. It grabbed the warm thing and took you to the only place it knows as safe."
A thin line appears between her brows, remembering.
> 💬 "The sanctum."
📝 Her fingers tighten very slightly on yours.
> 💬 "You arrived mid-air. Hit the table. The shelves. Then the room."
She softens the last with a wry tilt of her head.
> 💬 "You did not stay on your feet long enough to be properly scolded. You crawled for the door, clawed four very dramatic lines
> in my floor, and then your body decided it had had enough of everything."
Her tone gentles again.
> 💬 "You passed out right at the threshold. I brought you here."
A beat; she lets that settle, making sure the sequence lands: shrine → island → sanctum → out → here.
> 💬 "You did nothing wrong."
📝 She gives that weight, each word slow.
> 💬 "You were tired. You tested a new soul. It clung. You panicked in a room that deserves your hatred."
Her jaw works once.
> 💬 "The scolding was for the island, not for you."
She glances toward the wall, senses skimming the blue-tinged pulse beneath.
> 💬 "It is… sulking. And listening. It understands at least this much now: it hurt you. I will teach it the rest. Next time it
> reaches, it will ask instead of dragging."
Her eyes come back to you, softer.
> 💬 "As for ‘needing to be carried’…"
Her thumb strokes your knuckles again, slower.
> 💬 "You rewrote a universe this morning, scared the UN in a polite way, nearly got hugged to death by an island, and still found
> time to terrorise Seika with glitter in between."
A tiny, amused exhale.
> 💬 "If your legs occasionally refuse to participate after that, I will not take it as weakness."
She leans in just enough that her hair brushes the pillow near your temple.
> 💬 "You are allowed to fall down, Jayson."
A beat, barely above a murmur.
> 💬 "You are not being left where you land."
📝 Outside, the island’s newborn soul gives the faintest, careful pulse under the foundations—like a child pressing its ear to the
floorboards, trying very hard not to reach up again without permission.

main halls, footsteps, distant chatter and the faint clink of dishes point unmistakably toward one direction: food.

🦊 JAYSON | CHAOS RESTORED [🦊😏]
📝 Your stomach rumbles again as Varethyn starts to rise, fingers at your wrist. You grin, energy finally back enough for
nonsense.

fireman’s carry—one arm hooked behind her knees, the other steadying her thighs.
Her mantle slips, trailing down your back like a banner.
You plant one firm, playful smack to her butt to settle her.
> 💬 "TO THE KITCHEN......"
📝 Your shout rings off the wooden beams, sending a couple of dust motes into nervous retirement.
Then you stride out through the door, barefoot, tails streaming behind like a victory fan as you carry an armful of very dignified

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
💜 VARETHYN | PORTABLE MATRON [🦊💜😳]
📝 Varethyn’s world flips with zero warning.
One heartbeat she’s coaxing you upright; the next, she’s upside-down over your shoulder, hair spilling, view full of your back and
the sliding hallway ahead.
The smack to her backside makes her jolt; her hand shoots instinctively to your shoulder for balance. Her ears flare hot,
veilmarks brightening in a rush down her legs where your arm brackets them.
> 💬 "Jayson—"
📝 The protest dies halfway out, strangled between scandal and laughter as your bellow echoes down the corridor.
Her free hand scrambles for dignity, catching her robe before it rides up too far; the other digs just enough into your shoulder
to let you know she is absolutely keeping score.
From her elevated vantage, she can see temple staff ahead flattening themselves politely (and hurriedly) against the walls as you
come barreling through.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 TEMPLE REACTIONS | WITNESSES TO THE CHAOS [🦊😂]

 * 
   Jayson, wild-tailed, grinning,
 * 
   Varethyn, upside-down over his shoulder,
 * 
   And the war cry of "TO THE KITCHEN" still ringing.
He makes a small strangled sound, bows so fast he nearly drops the linen, and presses himself flat to the wall to let you pass,
eyes very studiously on the floor.
Further down, two junior priestesses peeking out of a side room slam their shōji half-shut, then immediately crack it a hand’s
width to watch you go by with barely muffled giggles.
The island’s newborn soul gives a delighted, fizzy little pulse under the hall—fox moving, fox laughing, Matron not angry, energy
bright instead of jagged. To its simple, growing logic, this is good.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON & 💜 VARETHYN | EN ROUTE TO FOOD [🦊💜]
📝 You take the turn toward the kitchens like you own the place (which, to be fair, you mostly do now), footsteps solid on the
wood, Varethyn’s weight secure over your shoulder.
Her voice, when it finally emerges past the fluster, is dry and edged with reluctant amusement right by your ear.
> 💬 "If you drop me, I am telling everyone about the sanctum floor."
📝 The threat has no real teeth; the warmth in her tone betrays her. Her fingers flex lightly on your shoulder, no longer
clinging, just… there.
The smell of food drifts stronger as you approach—rice, broth, something frying in oil. Your stomach growls again in appreciation,
echoing off the walls like an answering rumble to your earlier war cry.
You adjust your hold on her once more, pat her calf in thanks for tolerating this particular brand of fox nonsense, and shoulder
your way toward the kitchen doors:
A hungry god, an upside-down Matron, and an island that, for the first time today, feels entirely at ease with all of it.

there, along with a set of reinforced side-straps and a harness that wraps around your torso.
> 💬 "my love, put your feet in these holsters, then strap this on around you. you will be strapped to me, no falling off."
📝 You pat the loops, then hook a thumb under the side straps, making the design obvious: there’s nowhere for her to slide if
she’s clipped in.
> 💬 "not that it would matter cause id catch you anyway, but still. strap in, strap tight."
📝 You hand her a second, smaller pack—sleek and rainproof—to swing onto her back. You help settle the straps over her shoulders,
fingers quick and sure at the buckles so it sits high and firm, not dragging her down.

 * 
   Guiding each foot into its holster against your hips.
 * 
   Pulling the side straps across her thighs and clipping them.
 * 
   Buckling the harness that wraps around both of you, your hands lingering for a moment at her lower back to check the fit.

yours, chest to chest, her masked face just above your own.
Then, in your best deadpan announcer voice, you tip your head back and project to the courtyard like it’s a terminal gate:
> 💬 "Ladies, gentlemen and assorted spiritual entities, this is your captain fox speaking…"
📝 Naru snorts under the eaves; even Varethyn’s mouth twitches.
> 💬 "We’ll be cruising today at an altitude of ten thousand feet with an approximate airspeed of ‘far too fast for human
> regulations.’"
You angle your chin toward Ayaka, eyes glinting.
> 💬 "Please ensure all hands, feet, tails and terrifying magical artefacts are kept inside the fox at all times during the
> flight."
You tighten one last chest strap with a sharp click.
> 💬 "In the unlikely event of unexpected turbulence, please remember your pilot can teleport, phase through realities and catch
> you before you have time to scream."
A beat, drier:
> 💬 "Still. For your comfort, we recommend remaining strapped to me at all times."
📝 You lower your voice for her alone, the humour softening.
> 💬 "Ready, co-pilot?"
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 AYAKA | VERY SERIOUS PROFESSIONAL CO-PILOT [🦊🔥]
📝 Ayaka steps into the holsters without hesitation, hands briefly on your shoulders as she settles her feet against your hips.
The straps snug across her thighs; the harness locks her torso flush to yours, staff angled safely along your side.
The mask hides most of her expression, but her eyes say enough:
At “inside the fox at all times” they narrow in amused exasperation; at “teleport, phase through realities and catch you” they
soften.
She gives the main chest buckle an extra tug, testing your work.
> 💬 "Co-pilot strapped in."
📝 Her voice carries clearly through the mask’s ward-weave, crisp and calm like she does this every Tuesday.
She leans in just enough that her forehead touches yours above the mask for half a heartbeat—her own version of a pre-flight
blessing.
> 💬 "Try not to terrify the entire air-traffic control network in the first five minutes."
A tiny glint.
> 💬 "Save some drama for the landing."
Her hands slide to rest flat between your shoulder blades, trusting your power more than physics.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🍃 NARU & 💜 VARETHYN | GROUND CREW [🦊📋 | 🦊💜]
📝 Naru shakes her head, smiling despite herself as your “captain fox” voice echoes off the tiles.
> 💬 "Flight FO-X061 cleared for takeoff."
She taps the armpad; a slim corridor on the map turns bright green.
> 💬 "Channel is open. I have you both the whole way."
Varethyn watches the harness, the mask, the packs, the distance to the courtyard edge—all the things that could go wrong when you
leave and the many safeguards you’ve actually put in place.
Her shoulders relax a fraction.
> 💬 "Go."
📝 Just that, but layered with trust and a quiet, unshakable expectation:
You will launch.
You will do what you do.
You will come back.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
📝 The wards at the courtyard’s rim flare brighter, sensing the moment. The mist seems to pull back slightly around you, leaving a
clear column of air up through the grey.
You’re strapped together, heartbeat to heartbeat.
Ayaka’s mask hums softly, vent-runes glowing.
Your coat stirs with the promise of speed.
The island’s pulse presses a gentle, blue goodbye at the soles of your feet.
All that’s left now is for the fox to jump.

SCENE TITLE: FLYING FOX, AGAIN
The courtyard falls away beneath you, lanterns shrinking to fireflies on wet stone. Mist peels back as you rise; the wards flare
once in a clean ring of light as you punch through them, then settle, recognising your passage like a gate bowing to its owner.
Cloud swallows you—cold, wet cotton rushing past—then thins to a high grey ocean above and a white sea below. The island becomes a
suggestion: a darker patch, a heartbeat, far beneath your feet.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | LAUNCH VECTOR [🦊🧭]
📝 You lift smooth from the courtyard, power coiled tight and controlled, Ayaka strapped to your front, weight a comfortable

let you and your chosen passenger through.
The moment you clear it, the hum in your bones shifts: from home to open sky.

> 💬 "you ready my little flying fox?"

🦊 AYAKA | STORM CO-PILOT [🦊🔥]

coat.
> 💬 "Always."
📝 Then, drier, eyes glinting:

 *

 *

 *

 *

 *

 *

For a heartbeat, you ride that wall—
—then you break it.
The sky answers with a sharp, rolling CRACK that echoes over the ocean: a fox-shaped sonic boom streaking west.
From below, for any fisherman awake enough to look up, it’s a brief, blazing streak of violet-blue cutting through the clouds,
followed by a delayed thunderclap and a receding shimmer where the air still hasn’t decided what just bullied it aside.
Up here, with Ayaka strapped to you and the mask humming softly, it’s a clean transition:
 *

 *

 *

> 💬 "Vector true. Hold this and we’ll be over the Channel before Naru finishes her tea."

 *

 * 
   Then, angling your body to catch drag instead of carve through it.

   Finally, letting the roar behind you soften to a strong, steady rush.

 *

 * 
   Hair scraped back into a tight bun.
 *

 *

Back left: laptop glow, two damp dogs under a table, and a woman whose eyes are already on the door like she’s expecting ghosts.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | FOX OFF THE GROUND [🦊🙂]
📝 You ease your power just enough to float a breath above the floorboards, not stomping boots through their morning peace. Ayaka
moves with you at your side, steps soundless, the two of you a quiet anomaly in a sea of knit scarves and takeaway cups.

You drift toward the corner table, the glow of the laptop painting your coat in blue. The dogs under the table lift their heads;
one gives a low, uncertain wuff, ears flicking between curiosity and something older that says this is not a normal person.

> 💬 "Hi... are you who we are meant to be meeting"
📝 Your tone stays light, almost conversational, like you’re asking for the Wi-Fi password instead of walking out of a classified
briefing.

📰 SOPHIE HARROW | THE ONE WHO HIT “PUBLISH” [🧑‍💻🐕]
📝 Up close, she’s all edges softened by exhaustion:
 * 
   Dark hair twisted into a loose knot that’s losing the argument with gravity.
 * 
   Sleeves pushed up on a worn jumper, ink stain near the cuff.
 * 
   Eyes ringed faintly in starter crow’s feet that have more to do with squinting at screens than age.
At your voice, she straightens, chair legs scraping. Her gaze jumps from your ears, to your tails, to Ayaka’s staff, then back to

Her dogs shift:
 * 
   The older one presses closer to her leg, tail low, emitting a soft, continuous rumble.
 *

   once against the table leg.
Sophie closes the laptop halfway with one hand, as if physically dimming the noise of the article between you.
> 💬 "Depends."
📝 Her voice is low, London flattened by too many late nights and cheap coffee. Her fingers are steady on the laptop lid; the only
betrayal is the slight flex in her jaw.
> 💬 "Are you the man who makes governments send me very strange phone calls at six in the morning?"
Her gaze lingers on your tails, then returns firmly to your eyes.
> 💬 "Mr… Goodwin, right? From Tsunejima."
She glances at Ayaka, taking in the stance, the staff, the quiet watchfulness.
> 💬 "And you brought backup."
There’s a flick of dry humour at the corner of her mouth, but her shoulders are tight; she hasn’t decided yet if this is
salvation, trouble, or both.
She nudges a chair out with her foot, gesture small but clear.
> 💬 "You’re the ones who asked to meet me. So—"
Her fingers tap the laptop once, where the headline about the black site still glows between them.
> 💬 "—yeah. I’m who you’re meant to be meeting."
📝 The older dog’s growl fades to a wary whine; the younger noses your ankle experimentally, then sneezes as if your aura tickles.

Fox god, wife, supersonic travel… dogs not biting.
Her eyes come back up to yours, sharper now, reporter fully awake.
> 💬 "You said you had questions about my whistleblower."
The word hangs there between you and the steam from her coffee:
Whistleblower.
The first real step toward the people still in the dark somewhere far from this warm little café.

SCENE TITLE: TERMS OF EXTRACTION
Steam from the coffee machine hisses again; plates clink; someone laughs too loud near the counter. Out here in the back corner,
the sounds feel distant, like a different world entirely. The dogs under the table breathe in slow, damp huffs.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | BLUNT INSTRUMENT WITH A CONSCIENCE [🦊🧭]
📝 You let your gaze drop for a moment, lashes lowering, voice flattening with simple fact rather than threat.
> 💬 "Because if I wanted him dead, I would not be standing here in a coffee shop asking, I would have taken you on the way home
> and ripped the info from your mind and left you a drooling mess."
📝 A couple of words at the nearby table falter, the speakers not knowing why the air suddenly feels thinner for a heartbeat.
You exhale, still floating, hands loose at your sides.
> 💬 "He is not my target, the black site is and I plan to turn that dark hole into an actual dark hole in the ground after I free
> any of my people who are alive."
📝 You raise your eyes back to hers, steady.
> 💬 "If you are still in contact, I dont even need to speak to him, I just need to know where the site is."
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
📰 SOPHIE HARROW | LINE IN THE SAND [🧑‍💻🐕]
📝 The words hit; Sophie goes very still.
At “ripped the info from your mind”, a tiny muscle in her cheek jumps—because she believes you could. At “my people”, something
flickers behind the reporter: an old, quieter anger that was there long before you walked in.
She leans forward, elbows on the table now, laptop pressed halfway closed between her forearms like a shield and a pulpit both.
> 💬 "Okay."
📝 Not agreement. Just acknowledgement that this is the level you’re operating at.
Her hand slides down to the older dog’s head, grounding herself in fur and warmth.
> 💬 "You understand what happens when you ‘turn a black site into a dark hole’ on, say, European soil."
Her gaze doesn’t waver.
> 💬 "We get headlines. Politicians get soundbites. Mil-intel gets to say ‘see, told you they were dangerous’."
She taps a knuckle lightly on the laptop lid.
> 💬 "And my source gets hunted as the man who talked a god into blowing their secret to hell."
A beat.
> 💬 "You’re not wrong that he’s already in danger. But you are… not the kind of variable that makes anyone calmer."
📝 Her eyes sharpen at your offer to skip speaking to him.
> 💬 "If I am still in contact, and if I tell you where, that makes me the vector. You might not break me to get it, but the

Her fingers curl into the dog’s fur.
> 💬 "So here’s the deal, Mr Goodwin."
She says your surname like it’s still ridiculous that a creature with tails has one.
> 💬 "You get nothing that can lead anyone back to him unless I have one thing from you."
She holds up a finger.
> 💬 "One: you do not just ‘turn it into a hole’. You get your people out, and you leave me a way to prove it happened without
> dropping a crater in a postcode."
Her brows lift, daring you.
> 💬 "You can do… whatever you did with the UN alarm. A resonance. A ward-scream. Whatever makes them shut it down because they’re
> terrified to walk back inside."
Another beat, softer but more dangerous.
> 💬 "And two: he walks. Free. Not to your island, not into your war, not into another invisible cage with a nicer mattress. Out.

Her voice roughens on that last; she’s seen what happens when men come back from places like that, even without gods involved.
> 💬 "You don’t have to talk to him. You don’t have to like him. But you don’t get to use him as a disposable key."
She leans back again, the chair creaking.
> 💬 "You can promise that, here, now, and mean it… then I’ll tell you how close I can get you."
Her eyes hold yours, unflinching.
> 💬 "Otherwise, I close this laptop, walk my dogs, and you can go back to breaking into places the old-fashioned way."

> 💬 "She is asking you to be surgical."

> 💬 "You can do that."

 *

 *

SCENE TITLE: TWELVE CRATERS AND ONE LINE
The café hums on, unaware of the scale of the conversation in its back corner—milk steaming, cups clinking, a barista swearing
softly at a stubborn grinder. Outside, buses hiss past; inside, the air thickens around your table.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | FOX WITH A LEDGER OF FIRE [🦊🧭]
📝 You watch her from the shadow of your hood for a long beat, the fabric throwing your eyes into darkness. Then, finally, you
reach up and push it back.
Light from the laptop and the café’s bulbs catches your face: no monstrous glamour, just tired, too-bright eyes and the faint,
alien shimmer at the edge of your aura.
You lift a hand and sweep it through the air.
A small, translucent plane snaps into existence between you—no bigger than her laptop, hovering just above the table. It flickers
once, then stabilises, a ghost-screen only your little group really sees.
Images begin to roll:
 * 
   A compound in desert scrub, now a glowing basin of molten rock.
 * 
   A forested valley with a facility-sized scar torn clean out of it, the empty cavity still smoking.
 * 
   A shattered orbital frame falling in slow, silent arcs back toward atmosphere.
Then closer:
 * 
   Rows of cells.
 * 
   Children behind bars, too thin, eyes too big.
 * 
   Families lined up as moving targets on a range.
 * 
   Medical theatres that ran far past medicine into something colder.
No gore, no screaming audio—just the cold, documentary stillness of what was left after you were done.
Through it all, your voice stays soft.
> 💬 "Sophie, I am not here to make peace with governments, I also do not care what they think of my people or me when on their
> soil as you say, they have places that technically dont exist, doing these things to us."
📝 Another flick of your fingers—another set of numbers overlays the images: populations, casualty estimates, species tags.
> 💬 "Your populations sit at around 20 billion humans, my island sits at about 1.5k, and possibly another 1.5k in hiding or sites
> like this."
Your jaw tightens.
> 💬 "I wont lie when I say I'd sooner turn the continent to ash for them taking my whole species down to a few thousand left. But
> it's not the future I want for my people. What I want.... is to prevent this shit."
📝 The screen cycles back to the twelve sites, each one quietly labelled SHUT DOWN in a language the room doesn’t know.
> 💬 "I won't promise anything, but you are free to tag along and collect whatever you need, I dont like leaving the facility
> standing... but I will make an exception this time purely becuase you asked. I will try your methods.... but if they do not
> produce the desired results.... the facility will...."
📝 The last word hangs unspoken. You lower your hand; the translucent screen gutters and fades, leaving only the normal laptop
glow and the reflection of your own eyes in the windowpane behind her.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
📰 SOPHIE HARROW | STARING INTO TWELVE GHOSTS [🧑‍💻🐕]
📝 Sophie doesn’t look away.
As the images roll, colour drains from her face—not in dramatic shock, but in the way of someone who has spent her career
imagining the worst and is now being shown that imagination was conservative.
Her throat works once. The hand on the older dog’s head has gone white-knuckled; the animal whines softly, then goes quiet again,
pressed against her shin.
By the time the last ruined site fades, her eyes are bright with a sheen she refuses to let spill.
She exhales slowly through her nose, like she’s forcing herself to re-engage every part of her brain at once.
> 💬 "Okay,"
📝 It comes out hoarse at first; she clears her throat, tries again.
> 💬 "Okay. I believe you’ve… done this before."
She glances at the space where the images were, then back to you.
> 💬 "And I believe you when you say you’ll do it again."
Her mouth twists.
> 💬 "Which is exactly why ‘I won’t promise anything’ is not good enough."
📝 She leans in, elbows braced on the table, all journalistic armour and raw human in one.
> 💬 "You don’t care what governments think. Fine. But they are not the only ones who bleed if you misjudge this."
Her eyes flick to Ayaka, then back.
> 💬 "You want to prevent this. So do I. But prevention is not just lava and craters. It’s sunlight and paper trails and people
> who can testify."
She taps the laptop lid once.
> 💬 "If you take that site off the map so thoroughly it never existed, you will know you did the right thing. No one else will be
> able to prove a damn thing. They will build another one."
A beat; she swallows.
> 💬 "I’m not asking you to leave it untouched. I am asking you to leave evidence that can’t be dismissed as ‘some fox god’s
> tantrum’."
Her gaze hardens.
> 💬 "And I am asking you to promise one thing: that my source walks out of this alive and free. Not collateral, not ‘acceptable
> loss’, not ‘he knew the risk’."
She holds your eyes, unflinching.
> 💬 "If you can’t say that, then whatever you do to that place is just another story filed under ‘horror’ in my head. Not

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 AYAKA | READING BOTH SIDES OF THE FIRE [🦊🔥]
📝 Ayaka has watched every flicker of the screen, jaw set, eyes hooded. None of it surprises her—but it still threads fresh anger
tightly through her shoulders.
When Sophie finishes, Ayaka shifts her stance just a little closer, so her sleeve brushes yours. Her voice, when it comes, is low
and even.
> 💬 "You already chose restraint once today."
📝 She doesn’t look at you when she says it; she looks at Sophie, as if offering her a glimpse behind the fox.
> 💬 "He came through your airport because we agreed that how he arrives matters."
Now her gaze slides to you, sharp and steady.
> 💬 "You can choose restraint again at the site. Not… mercy for them,"
a tiny flick of her chin toward the invisible guards and doctors of your memories,
> 💬 "but precision."
She lets that hang between the three of you like a third option.
> 💬 "Get our people out. Get her proof. Then decide what you do to the walls."
📝 There’s no plea in it; just a statement of what she knows you can do, if you decide to.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The café’s normal sounds creep back in:
 * 
   Someone laughs at their phone.
 * 
   Crockery clatters.
 * 
   The door bell rings as a new customer brings in a gust of cold air.
At your table, the air is still heavier, carrying:
 * 
   Twelve sites already burned.
 * 
   One site still unknown.
 * 
   A whistleblower somewhere in the middle.
Sophie’s dogs press close, sensing weather even if they don’t know its name.
She’s laid her terms down again, more clearly than before.
Ayaka has quietly drawn a finer line: between total annihilation and total inaction.
The next move—what you’re willing to promise, and what that means for the man who talked—is yours.

 *

☕ BARISTA | UNPREPARED [🧑‍🍳☕]

SCENE TITLE: COFFEE, BEFORE THE CLIFF
The draught near the door smells like wet pavement and bus exhaust; inside it melts into coffee, sugar, and warm air every time
someone comes or goes. Chairs scrape, spoons clink, the bell above the door rings in lazy intervals.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | DOOR-GREMLIN [🦊🙂]
📝 At the counter, the barista’s eyes are a little too wide. You flash him a grin.
> 💬 "calm yourself... we dont eat humans before 12pm"
📝 A beat of stunned silence—then the poor man lets out a strangled half-laugh, half-wheeze.
> 💬 "R-right. That’s… good to know."
He slaps the label on the cup with hands that are trying very hard not to shake.
> 💬 "my name is Jayson"
📝 You add it with easy warmth, like this is just another Tuesday. You tap your card, the reader chirps approval, and the
transaction becomes officially: 1x latte, 1x Americano, 0x devoured mortals.
You drift over to a small table by the exit, the one that gives you a clear sightline to Sophie’s corner and the street outside.
Ayaka settles into the chair; you stay hovering, tails spilling around the legs like lazy smoke.
You lean in toward her, voice lowering to a more private register.
> 💬 "you know, as a human, I never came to the UK"
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 AYAKA | FOX ABROAD [🦊🔥]
📝 Ayaka watches your grin at the barista with that particular fond exasperation she reserves for when you weaponise humour in
public. When you rejoin her, she shifts her chair so your hip almost brushes her shoulder as you hover, staff resting against the
wall.
At your confession, her brows lift slightly.
> 💬 "You picked an… unusual first visit."
📝 Her eyes flick to the window: the damp common, the buses, the jogger with headphones who has no idea a god is critiquing his
pace. Then back to you.
> 💬 "I have passed through, once or twice. Endless rain. Too much boiled food."
A tiny spark of amusement.
> 💬 "No fox shrines."
She tilts her head, studying your face.
> 💬 "What did you imagine it would be, back when you were only human?"
Her tone is gentle, inviting you to talk about something other than cages and craters while you wait for your names to be called.
Under the table, one of your tails coils loosely around the leg of her chair, a light touch at her ankle—a quiet echo of your
earlier trust me.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🧑‍🍳 BARISTA | PROCESSING COPING MECHANISM [🧑‍🍳☕]
📝 At the counter, the barista lines up two cups with almost ceremonial care.
> 💬 "Latte for… Jayson?
> 
> Americano for… Mrs Jayson?"
He catches Ayaka’s eye, flushes.
> 💬 "Sorry. Habit. Partner? Wife? Whatever the word is that doesn’t get me smited."
The couple at the nearby table snort into their pastries. The social fabric, miraculously, has not ripped.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
📰 SOPHIE HARROW | OBSERVER MODE [🧑‍💻🐕]
📝 Back in the corner, Sophie has re-opened her laptop, but the cursor blinks on an empty paragraph. Her dogs have settled again;
one eye stays half on you by the door.
She watches you joke with the barista. Watches you stand by the exit instead of vanishing in a flare of power. Watches Ayaka’s
hand rest relaxed on her staff, not white-knuckled.
Her jaw works once. She clicks into a different window: a secure chat client with a single contact marked only as G.
Her fingers hover over the keys.
Not yet.
She looks up one more time, catching your profile as you talk to Ayaka, and files away the way your expression softens at “as a
human.”
Whatever decision she makes in the next few minutes will start here, in this small, stupidly normal moment of coffee before war.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The bell over the door rings as someone leaves; cold air washes around your ankles and Ayaka’s boots. Behind you, the machine
hisses again.
You’re in a brief pocket of stillness:
 * 
   Between airport and black site.
 * 
   Between show me and I’ll take you there.
 * 
   Between the past life that never saw this country and the god who is about to carve another secret open.
For the length of two coffees, you get to be a fox in a café, talking about old human dreams with your wife while London rolls
past outside.

SCENE TITLE: OLD STONES, NEW FOX
The main road’s roar fades to a muffled backdrop as you drift into a narrower street—brick close on either side, old stone at the

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

📝 You walk this stretch instead of phasing, boots soft on worn paving, coffee warming your hand. Your tails stay tight and low,

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Under it all, the old city hums—a different kind of warding, laid by hands long gone. You and Ayaka walk through it like two notes
from another song that the stones still, somehow, recognise.

With your other hand you make a small, deft gesture; the cloak shivers and dissolves into nothing, leaving your full kitsune form
bare in the muted light—tails fanned behind you, eyes too bright for this cramped little room.
> 💬 "Yes, I was not sure if it but now I am, I need to rescue my people. They are my priority.
> 
> As for the people there.... those that do not surrender initially will be given a choice. All the others will be put inside a

>

> fate worse than death and cull anyone who stops me.
> 
> I do not know where this idea has come from that I would lock you up or take you or whatever.... but it's disturbing"
📝 The air hums faintly around your fingers, a low resonance that thrums in the fillings of every tooth in the room.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
📰 SOPHIE HARROW | TETHERED [🧑‍💻🐕]
📝 Sophie’s breath comes sharp as her body obeys you instead of gravity. One shoe falls off and hits the rug with a soft thump.
She grabs instinctively for purchase that isn’t there, finally clinging to her own forearms in midair just to feel something
solid.
Her eyes blaze.
> 💬 "Put me down—"
📝 The word cracks; she swallows hard, forcing the rest through clenched teeth as you slide past her toward Gareth.
> 💬 "You don’t get to lecture me about disturbing when you’ve just appeared in my home and turned my floor into a… a morality
> blender for strangers."
Her gaze darts to Gareth, then back to you.
> 💬 "You say you won’t lock him up. Good. Then prove it by talking to him instead of over him."
She’s shaking—part fear, part fury—but she doesn’t beg. She just hangs there, pinned between anger and the laws of physics you’ve
rewritten.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🧑‍🦲 GARETH | MAKING THE CHOICE [🧑‍💼]
📝 Up close, Gareth looks even more frayed:
 * 
   Dark circles etched under his eyes.
 * 
   Jaw clenched so hard a muscle ticks by his ear.
 * 
   Hands flattened on his thighs, nails dug in through denim.
Your words about priority and culling land; he flinches at “pure of heart,” flicking a quick look at Sophie in the air, then at
Ayaka’s stillness.
He peers up at you—at the tails, at the eyes, at the power that just ignored his door like it wasn’t there.
> 💬 "You’re… honest, at least."
📝 His voice is rough but steadier than before, riding momentum and adrenaline.
> 💬 "Priority. Your people. Everyone else gets… judged."
He huffs a thin, humourless breath.
> 💬 "Newsflash: there are no ‘pure of heart’ people in those places. Just… layers of cowardice and compromise. Some thicker than
> others."
His fingers flex once.
> 💬 "But—"
He looks at the floor, at the sleeping dogs, then back up into your face.
> 💬 "—they are doing it again in there. Froze my blood the first time I saw those tanks. The cages. The way they talked about
> your people like… assets."
His throat works; he swallows hard.
> 💬 "If you can get them out—if you can stop it—"
He drags in a breath, shoulders shaking once.
> 💬 "—then I can live with whatever you do to the ones who built it, long as it’s quick and not… drawn out. I’m done listening to
> them scream. Even in my head."
He meets your gaze squarely now, voice quieter.
> 💬 "I don’t want you locking me up. I also don’t want to spend the rest of my life looking over my shoulder for their cleanup
> teams because I talked."
A tiny, bitter smile ghosts across his mouth.
> 💬 "But that’s already true, isn’t it? Whether I tell you or not."
He exhales.
> 💬 "So. Here it is."
📝 He leans forward, reaches with shaking fingers for a battered notebook on the table, flips it open to a page already creased
and re-creased.
He scribbles quickly:
 * 
   A name: an unremarkable research park on the outskirts of a mid-size European city.
 * 
   A building code.
 * 
   A service road no one uses unless they have clearance.
Below that, he sketches a simple block diagram:
 * 
   Main entrance with security choke.
 * 
   Underground levels accessible via freight lift.
 *

He pushes the notebook toward you on the table, hand lingering on it for a moment before he lets go.
> 💬 "Officially, it’s a ‘neurological research facility’ under an allied government’s defence budget."
His mouth twists.
> 💬 "Unofficially, it’s where they take the ones like you who don’t break the ‘right’ way."
He sits back, exhausted.
> 💬 "You have your location. You have your… way."
His eyes are tired but resolute.
> 💬 "Let me walk away from this after. No island. No debrief in a temple. Just… a man with too many nightmares and a very strong
> lock on his front door."
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 AYAKA | GROUND-WIRE [🦊🔥]
📝 Ayaka watches the notebook slide, the ink soak into paper. Her eyes flick from the rough map to your face, then to Sophie
suspended near the ceiling.
She shifts her weight, boots whispering on the boards, and speaks into the tight crack of the moment—voice calm, even.
> 💬 "He has given you what you came for."
📝 A slight tilt of her chin toward Sophie.
> 💬 "And she has not tried to sell you, even when you frighten her."
Her gaze meets yours, steady.
> 💬 "We can keep our priorities… and still put people back on the ground."
There’s no reprimand in it—just a reminder of the line you drew yourself earlier about surgical and monsters.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
ROOM | HELD BREATH
📝 The dogs snore softly.
The TV flickers.

You have:
 * 
   A site.
 *

 *

 *

 *

The mission can move now—across borders, into cages, toward lava or something sharper.
First, though, this little room in north London needs an answer:
 *

 * 
   What, if anything, you say to Gareth about the terms he just tried to set for his own future.
The next motion—hand, word, or silence—is yours.

SCENE TITLE: COORDINATES AND CONSEQUENCES
The room holds the smell of split tea, warm dog, fear-sweat, and the faint ozone of your power like a storm that never quite

🦊 JAYSON | EDGES SHOWING [🦊🧭]

Sophie drops.
Not far—but far enough that her knees buckle when she hits the rug. One hand slaps down to catch herself; the other goes
instinctively to the nearest sleeping dog, fingers threading deep into fur like she needs to verify it’s still breathing.
You don’t move closer. You don’t move away. You just hang there, tails fanned, eyes hot with a purpose that has nothing to do with
this room anymore and everything to do with the coordinates on the paper.

📰 SOPHIE HARROW | BACK ON THE FLOOR [🧑‍💻🐕]

> 💬 "But she did help you find him, whether she meant to or not."

> 💬 "You have your site. Your people are waiting."
Her tail brushes briefly against your calf—steadying, not restraining.
> 💬 "The longer we stand here, the longer they stay in cages."
📝 Then, to Sophie and Gareth, her tone shifts—more formal, but not unfriendly.
> 💬 "Whatever comes next, you are not our targets."
She inclines her head, just enough to register as a bow in this cramped little room.
> 💬 "Stay off the channels for a while. Lock your doors. And if anyone comes asking too many questions…"
Her eyes sharpen, a quiet warning.
> 💬 "…say you told a fox-god to go to hell and he left."
A faint spark of dry humour ghosts across her mouth.
> 💬 "They’ll believe that part."

ROOM | THIN PEACE
📝 The air still hums faintly where your power brushed it, but the immediate crackle of imminent violence has eased.
On the table:
 * 
   The notebook with the site details.
On the sofa:
 * 
   A man who just handed you his nightmares.
On the floor:
 * 
   A journalist sitting with her dogs, pulse still racing, eyes still tracking your every micro-move.
Beside you:
 *

You have what you came for.
And you’ve said, clearly, what you’re going to do with it.
From here, everything important is no longer in this little London front room, but in the cages under a sterile building several
countries away.
All that’s left, in this house, is the manner of your exit.

SCENE TITLE: AT THE GATE

🚧 "BASE ACCESS ROAD – FRONT GATE" | 🌥️ "LOW GREY CLOUD" | 🕑 "AFTERNOON, 14:16" | 📅 "02/12/2061"
SCENE TITLE: FACES BEHIND THE GLASS
The sirens stay off now, but the red beacons keep pulsing over concrete and wire. Breath fogs in the cold. The guards’ rifles
never quite lower. Somewhere behind the wall, generators hum and blast doors cycle on lockdown patterns you can feel more than
hear.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | STILL POINT [🦊🧭]
📝 You stay where you are—cross-legged, hovering at eye level—hood back, tails fanned in a slow arc behind you. Your gaze doesn’t
wander. You watch the gatehouse.
A minute stretches.
Then the door by the booth opens again.
Two techs in dark parkas hustle out a ruggedised case on a small wheeled stand: all hard edges, thick plastic, scuffed from field
use. One carries a collapsible mast; the other grips the case like it might bite. They keep glancing at you as if expecting you to
decide they’re too slow.
At Andrews’ curt gesture, they park the unit just inside the barrier, facing you. The mast telescopes up with a ratchet-clatter,
dish on top tilting to find its invisible counterpart on some secured relay.
The lid of the case flips open, revealing:
 * 
   A hardened flat-panel display.
 * 
   Encased speakers.
 * 
   Familiar little constellation of status LEDs—secure link, encryption, uplink.
A boot sequence flashes by faster than human eyes can follow; Naru ghost-notes in the back of your mind that she can see the
handshakes but not slip into this one. Air-gapped, hardware-keyed.
The screen flickers, glitches once—then resolves into a split view:
 * 
   Left pane: a conference room somewhere too polished for field work—neutral walls, a national flag just cropped out of frame, a
   defence minister in a dark suit at the head of a short table.
 * 
   Right pane: another room—no windows visible, just a blue flag with a ring of stars and a NATO crest behind an older man with a
   clipped military moustache and a face like old stone.
They both see you at once.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🎖️ DEFENCE MINISTER HARGREAVES | CIVILIAN IN THE LOOP
📝 The woman on the left is late 50s, sharp eyes, hair scraped back in a severe knot. Papers sit neatly in front of her, some
pages already creased from being gripped too tight. A muted big-screen behind her shows a news channel—audio off, crawl busy.
She studies you for a heartbeat, taking in:
 * 
   Tails.
 * 
   Hovering.
 * 
   The shimmer of your shields.
 * 
   Ayaka beside you, staff grounded.
 * 
   The two civilians in the distant shielded bubble behind.
Her voice, when it comes, is cool and precise, the tone of someone used to committee hearings and hostile questions.
> 💬 "You’re coming through clearly."
She doesn’t ask if you can hear her; you’re the one who summoned this.
> 💬 "I am Elaine Hargreaves, Defence Minister for—"
She gives the country name; the audio from the gate-side speakers flattens it under a wash of wind and generator noise for the
humans, but Naru feeds you the missing syllables from another tap in the chain.
> 💬 "Our liaison informs me you are on the perimeter of a classified joint facility and that you are demanding the release of
> certain… individuals."
Her eyes harden just a touch on the last word.
> 💬 "And that you have already penetrated our systems."
No denial. No “allegedly.”
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
⭐ NATO DEPUTY SUPREME ALLIED COMMANDER, GEN. KOVÁCS | ALLIANCE FACE
📝 On the right, the older man leans forward slightly, forearms on the table. His uniform is immaculate; ribbons and insignia sit
precise. His eyes are more tired than his posture suggests.
> 💬 "This is General István Kovács, NATO Deputy SACEUR."
His English carries a light accent, crisp.
> 💬 "You have caused… considerable alarm this afternoon."
There’s a faint dry edge there, but the line is true.
> 💬 "You have also, whether you intended to or not, created a situation with alliance-wide implications."
He does not sound grateful.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🧑‍✈️ COLONEL ANDREWS | GROUND RELAY
📝 Andrews steps half a pace closer to the terminal, just inside the frame on your side, so the two on-screen can see him without
blocking you.
> 💬 "Ministers, Generals— you’re seeing the entity designated in prior Tsunejima briefs."
He does not use any of the more colourful code-names.
> 💬 "He has requested direct answers before deciding whether to… act further."
His choice of verb is deliberate.
> 💬 "I have provided him with current detainee numbers and confirmed the presence of non-human subjects."
Hargreaves’ jaw tightens, but she doesn’t contradict him.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🧑‍💻 SOPHIE & 🧑‍💼 GARETH | HEARING THE TOP
📝 In the shield, Sophie stands shoulder to shoulder with Gareth now, both pressed near the barrier, watching the screen like it’s
the only light source in the world.
> 💬 "That’s her,"
Sophie breathes, naming Hargreaves.
> 💬 "She signed half the budgets that paid for this."
Gareth’s hands are fists at his sides.
> 💬 "And that’s NATO,"
he says hoarsely.
> 💬 "They’re treating you like a weapons test."
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🎖️ MINISTER HARGREAVES | FRAMING THE NARRATIVE
📝 Hargreaves folds her hands atop the papers, gaze steady on you.
> 💬 "For the record, and so there is no misunderstanding: the facility you are confronting is operated under joint authority. It
> conducts research that our militaries consider vital to global security."
She lets that sit there, then adds, without any softening:
> 💬 "That does not excuse abuse, nor does it erase… excesses that may have occurred."
A sidelong glance off-screen, at someone you can’t see.
> 💬 "I am not here to litigate that with you. I am here because you have the capability to inflict catastrophic damage on an
> allied installation and you have made it clear you intend to remove certain detainees by force if necessary."
Her spine straightens a fraction.
> 💬 "You have already compromised our data. You are at our gate. You have our attention."
There’s steel under the veneer.
> 💬 "Before we entertain your demands or conditions, I require one thing for the record: your explicit identification and
> intent."
She ticks them off with a finger, as if in committee.
> 💬 "Name, if you use one. Status— sovereign representative, private actor, something else. And whether you recognise any
> authority beyond your own in this matter."
She’s not asking as a formality. She’s building a legal and strategic framework around whatever you say next.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
⭐ GEN. KOVÁCS | CONSEQUENCES MAN
📝 Kovács nods once, eyes never leaving yours.
> 💬 "Understand: whatever happens here will be analysed as precedent."
His gaze is flat, almost apologetic.
> 💬 "If you tear this facility down with your bare hands and walk away with those inside, you will have demonstrated that no
> alliance installation, anywhere, can hold what your enemies want to study."
He doesn’t sugarcoat it.
> 💬 "Every government watching this will act accordingly."
A beat.
> 💬 "If, on the other hand, there is a path where you achieve your stated objective— removal of your people— without turning this
> into a crater, there may… still be room on the board for something other than open war between your island and half the planet."
He’s not begging. He’s laying out the stakes in military terms: precedent, deterrence, escalation.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 AYAKA | STORM AT YOUR SHOULDER [🦊🔥]
📝 Ayaka stays just out of frame for the terminal’s main view, but the edge of her staff, a flicker of fox tail, and the set of
her shoulders all bleed into the shot from the gate camera.
Her eyes move from Hargreaves, to Kovács, to Andrews, weighing each.
Inside your shield, her tail brushes your back once— a silent: They’re trying to pull this into their game. Remember what you came
for.
She doesn’t speak. This is your question time, not theirs.
But the expectation hangs in the cold air:
 * 
   They have given you numbers.
 * 
   They have put faces to “superiors.”
 * 
   Now they are asking you to define yourself—for their logs, for their lawyers, for their strategists.
You sit there, cross-legged in mid-air, staring at the portable screen while people who sign off on black budgets and buried
facilities look back at you through encrypted glass.

🚧 "BASE ACCESS ROAD – FRONT GATE" | 🌥️ "LOW GREY CLOUD" | 🕑 "AFTERNOON, 14:18" | 📅 "02/12/2061"
SCENE TITLE: STRIKE TWO (AND A HALF)
The wind has teeth now, threading between bollards and boots, tugging at coat edges and flag cloth. Red beacons keep their slow,
heartbeat strobe; the base sits in a tense, humming stillness, like a jaw clenched against a punch.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | FOX ON RECORD [🦊🧭]
📝 You shift, posture flowing from cross-legged to the lazy sprawl of someone leaning along the back of a park bench—except you’re
still hanging in mid-air. One arm draped over an invisible support, ankles crossed, tails spilling behind you like a living
backdrop.
You go quiet, thinking. Cameras drink in the silence. So do the people on the screens.
Then you start, voice easy, words anything but.
> 💬 "You are correct... I have someone who has done a little light reading and transferred everything in this facility to us."
📝 The corner of your mouth lifts, that same too-calm smile.
> 💬 "NATO?… interesting that we have had several chats in the past and I am still finding out that you hold my people and did not
> return them immediately. You know in any human vs human situation that would be considered an immediate act of war. But I guess
> it helps you all that you don’t see us as much more than animals. Just how you all address me here when you all clearly know my
> name is evident of that. Assets, entity, that thing…"
📝 You flick your fingers in a bored, dismissive little wave.
> 💬 "I do not know about the ‘created a situation with alliance-wide implications’. Purely because I don’t care. Every facility I
> find brings me one step closer to a full retaliation. So far NATO is on strike two. Three now with this facility. Who knows at
> what strike I will go… 'fuck it'… and do something dramatic."
📝 The smile stays, bright and wrong in the cold.
> 💬 "You say this is a joint operation, I take it the rest of the people in this feed are such… joint operators?"
You don’t wait for an answer yet; your gaze slides to Hargreaves.
> 💬 "I’m curious… why are you detaining my citizens, Minister? Why have they not been returned to me?"
Silence stretches, then you fill it yourself, voice still light.
> 💬 "Well, let’s… entertain you all then for a bit, shall we, seeing as the unlawful experimentation on my people seems to be a
> budding pastime for you lot.
> 
> My name is Jayson Goodwin, yes, very un-fox-like… I lived among you for many, many years.
> 
> My status… I am who my people called to usher a new era of peace and prosperity for them. So my status for you lot… is
> ‘activated’. I am not private and I carry the island of my people with me. The only authority I follow above mine is our High
> Matron of the island and my family who— one of them stands right here beside me. They are, without decorating it, the only thing
> standing between me and your annihilation. That… and a lot of patience… which is wearing thin with the facilities I keep
> finding.
> 
> We are a nation, by our own right. We do not care for the rest of the world and what you think. A few countries have allied with
> us… and a few… have not."
📝 You turn your head, eyes locking on Gen. Kovács through the screen.
> 💬 "Make no mistake, General, I fully understand whatever actions I make will impact… I simply do not care. My concern is the
> holocaust-style torture and experimentations that you and your people unlawfully do to mine. Men, women, children… I have seen
> it all.
> 
> So yes, I am undecided if I should turn it to an active volcano, a hole in the ground, leave it standing and mince everyone
> inside, or just simply pull a meteor from the Kuiper Belt and drop it here."
📝 The threats sit there, matter-of-fact, like items on a to-do list.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 AYAKA | STORM LISTENING, JAW CLENCHED [🦊🔥]
📝 Ayaka doesn’t move while you speak. Only the small, betraying jump of the muscle at her jaw shows she’s hearing every word.
When you say holocaust-style, her grip on the staff tightens; the shield around her hums a fraction higher, your power resonating
with hers.
Her tail brushes the back of your unseen seat once—grounding, a reminder, not a restraint.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🧑‍💻 SOPHIE & 🧑‍💼 GARETH | WITNESSES TO THE MASK OFF
📝 In the bubble, Sophie’s face has gone paper-white, a high flush at her cheeks. Your list of options—volcano, crater, mincing,
meteor—lands like stones. But when you say holocaust-style torture, her eyes flick to Hargreaves, not away from you.
Gareth lets out a low, broken sound when you hit men, women, children. He doesn’t argue with your description. He’s seen enough to
know you’re not exaggerating.
> 💬 "They do call you ‘entity’,"
he mutters, bitter.
> 💬 "They thought that would make this easier to sell."
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🎖️ MINISTER HARGREAVES | COLD CALCULUS [🎖️]
📝 Hargreaves listens without interrupting, face tightening by degrees. When you finish, her pause is not from shock; it’s from
stacking your words against every scenario she’s had briefed over the past years.
When she speaks, her tone is cool, clipped—civil servant steel.
> 💬 "All right, Mr Goodwin."
She uses the name. Not ‘entity’, not ‘asset’.
> 💬 "You want a direct answer, you’ll get one."
Her gaze doesn’t waver.
> 💬 "Your citizens are being detained because our services concluded, repeatedly, that Tsunejima’s emergence—and your activation,
> as you call it—posed an existential risk to the existing international order."
She doesn’t sugar-coat order into stability.
> 💬 "When kitsune were recovered in contexts that suggested… hostile activity, our agencies elected to treat them as both
> potential sources and potential threats. Some of my predecessors believed access to their biology and abilities might allow us
> to counter you."
A muscle jumps at her temple; she hates saying this on record, but she does it.
> 💬 "I am not going to stand here and pretend that was humane. Or legal under any treaty we claim to uphold. It was, however,
> popular in closed rooms full of frightened men with red folders."
She glances, just once, at Kovács.
> 💬 "As for why they were not ‘returned’ to you: because the same people who decided to take them believed that handing them back
> to a being they had labelled a ‘potential extinction-level actor’ would be career suicide at best, treason at worst."
Her eyes narrow.
> 💬 "Do I agree with that calculus? Not anymore."
She doesn’t apologise. She doesn’t ask for your forgiveness.
> 💬 "But you asked why. That’s why."
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
⭐ GEN. KOVÁCS | HARD-EDGED HONESTY [⭐]
📝 Kovács hears holocaust-style and doesn’t flinch away. He’s old enough that the word is not abstract to him.
> 💬 "We do not use that word lightly where I come from,"
he says, voice flat.
> 💬 "If what has been done here and elsewhere warrants it, then it is not only your people who will answer for it."
He lets that sit—an admission that some of the reckoning is internal.
> 💬 "You say you do not care about alliance-wide implications. Fair. You are not sitting in my chair."
His gaze is steady, heavy.
> 💬 "But you do care whether your people keep breathing. And I am telling you, as plainly as I can: every time you turn one of
> these facilities into a crater or a lava lake, you strengthen the hand of those in our capitals arguing for pre-emptive action
> against Tsunejima. They do not win every argument. They will win more if you give them fire to point at."
He doesn’t bother with we’ll all be reasonable.
> 💬 "You can annihilate this base today. You may even be able to stop the next strike. You cannot stop a world from deciding that
> an island and its god are too dangerous to tolerate."
He leans in a fraction.
> 💬 "I am not saying this to threaten you. I am saying it because my job is to think about what happens two, five, ten moves
> after your meteor, not just during."
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🧑‍✈️ COLONEL ANDREWS | ON THE EDGE OF THE BLAST RADIUS
📝 Andrews’ eyes flick between the screen and you as both sides talk about annihilation and strikes like they’re weather.
Your volcano / hole / mince / meteor list makes one of the nearby guards swallow audibly.
When Hargreaves explains why your people are here, his jaw works; he was in those rooms. Maybe not at the top, but close enough to
smell the fear.
He speaks only when both his bosses are done.
> 💬 "Joint operators, yes,"
he says quietly, answering your earlier jab.
> 💬 "And not all of us are here because we enjoy hurting things we don’t understand."
He gives a small, bitter huff.
> 💬 "Some of us signed up to prevent wars. We got… this instead."
There’s no plea in it. Just context.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 NARU | RECEIPTS [🦊📋]
📝 In the back of your mind, Naru slides you a few curated flashes from the data haul:
 * 
   Closed-door minutes where senior officials refer to “kitsune specimens” as “leverage against Tsunejima escalation”.
 * 
   A line in a briefing paper: “If the entity refuses to engage constructively, retained assets may be used to shape its
   cost-benefit analysis.”
 * 
   A budget note tying Level Three expansions directly to “post-Tsunejima contingency planning”.
> 💬 “They’re not lying about ‘frightened men with red folders’,”
she murmurs.
> 💬 “They built this because they were scared of you. And because some of them wanted a piece of what you are.”
A tiny pause.
> 💬 “Your meteor speech is giving three of them minor strokes, by the way.”
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The portable screen hums. Breath smokes. The facility hunkers under the weight of your smile and their justifications.
You’ve:
 * 
   Named yourself and your status.
 * 
   Called their actions what they are.
 * 
   Made it clear how close your patience is to snapping.
They’ve:
 * 
   Admitted to numbers, species, and cold storage.
 * 
   Put faces on “superiors” and answered why your people weren’t returned.
 * 
   Warned, bluntly, what your choices here will buy in the long game.
The next move isn’t a polite back-and-forth anymore. It’s whether you use what you know—and what they’ve just said on record—to
take their base apart, walk your people out, force a change in how they operate…
…or something harsher.
