🚧 "BASE ACCESS ROAD – FRONT GATE" | 🌥️ "LOW GREY CLOUD" | 🕑 "AFTERNOON, 14:21" | 📅 "02/12/2061"
SCENE TITLE: STRIKE THREE LOOMING
The red beacons strobe over concrete and wire, over rifles and shields, over your smile that does not match the words coming out
of your mouth. The wind bites a little harder as you lean back in the air, staring up into the grey.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | SMILING AT THE SKY [🦊🧭]
📝 You shift again, posture turning into the lazy sprawl of someone lounging along a bench, arm hooked over an invisible backrest,
still hovering. The smile never leaves your face—even as the content of your voice digs deeper.
> 💬 "And yet not a single western nation ever once accepted my invite to come to our home and simply talk. A few east Asian
> countries have, and we allied, opened trade and such.
> 
> I have also stated that although I am a Kitsune, I am a Kitsune god-like being. And my power is not held by anyone, including my
> people, other than myself and one other I will not name today.
> 
> Minister... keeping my people is one thing, cutting them open, experiments, target practice!! In the US I took out 9 bodies from
> a facility there of women and their children still clutching each other dead from gun fire......."
📝 The words drag images into the cold air; one of the younger guards goes a little green around the edges.
> 💬 "You sound like you are all fully aware of what I can do... yet I keep finding myself at places like this, keep listening to
> the 'yeah sure we will stop's and 'oh we panicked' and I love the 'oh don’t wipe us out, set an example, show the world'.... and
> here I am.... again.... with a power output of 1.96 × 10⁶⁸ joules.... a lot of frustration and nowhere to release it without
> removing this corner of the universe from existence."
📝 Your gaze drops from the clouds to lock on Kovács.
> 💬 "My people on my island are safe, that is guaranteed and everyone we put under the island’s shield is a win. I am fully aware
> that there will be ones that don’t get to come home, but my numbers are growing, and your black sites are shrinking. You will
> eventually run out of my people to cut open, and when that time comes.... we can see together what happens.
> 
> The fact that I even entertain these interactions baffles even myself.
> 
> Believe me or not, but the only thing these facilities give you.... is front row seats to me when I come knocking one day.... so
> yes, I turn facilities into holes.... and if I keep having to do it... the holes are going to start including villages and
> towns.... and I will keep going up from there...."
📝 You lean back, eyes back on the clouds, sighing softly—still wearing that wrong, pleasant smile.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 AYAKA | STORM AT YOUR SHOULDER [🦊🔥]
📝 Ayaka’s jaw tightens as you speak of women and children clutching each other. You feel it in the way her hand firms on the
staff, in the slight rise of power in your shared shield—a sympathetic vibration, like a string drawn a little tighter.
At “villages and towns,” her ears flick back for a heartbeat, then forward again. She doesn’t correct you. She doesn’t soften you.
She just stands there, very still, fox-fire contained in a narrow, dangerous band.
Her tail brushes your back once: a pulse of I’m here in the middle of you are terrifying them.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🧑‍💻 SOPHIE & 🧑‍💼 GARETH | FRONT ROW SEATS INDEED
📝 In the bubble, Sophie’s hand has crept up to cover her mouth. The way you talk about villages and towns makes her stomach
lurch—but when you spit out “women and their children still clutching each other dead from gun fire,” her eyes go straight to the
screens, not away from you.
> 💬 "They shot them,"
she whispers, the words barely audible.
Gareth’s face is a ruin of guilt and vindication.
> 💬 "That’s the US site,"
he mutters.
> 💬 "The one they said was ‘compromised during an escape attempt’."
His fists tighten until his knuckles creak when you talk about running out of people to cut open.
> 💬 "They thought you’d stop when they ran out,"
he says hoarsely.
> 💬 "That’s the part they never wanted to say out loud."
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🎖️ MINISTER HARGREAVES | CORNERED, NOT COWED [🎖️]
📝 Hargreaves listens, the colour draining slightly from her face at the mention of the US facility. Her eyes flick for just a
heartbeat off-screen—a mental cross-reference to briefings she’s read with those exact casualty counts disguised as “losses during
security incident.”
When you’re done, she doesn’t try to match your smile. She folds her hands tighter, knuckles shading white.
> 💬 "No western nation came."
Her voice is very level.
> 💬 "You’re right. They were invited. They stayed away."
She doesn’t dodge.
> 💬 "Fear and arrogance. The conviction that if we stepped onto your island, we would be stepping onto… your board, under your
> rules. Better, they thought, to watch from orbit and send drones. To build places like this."
Her mouth twists briefly.
> 💬 "You call it a holocaust. Some of what I’ve seen in the last thirty minutes makes that word less rhetorical than it should
> be."
She glances down at the papers, then discards them with a tiny, irritated flick, as if they’re suddenly irrelevant.
> 💬 "But understand this, Mr Goodwin: if you start adding villages and towns to your craters, you will prove every hawk in every
> capital correct."
Her eyes harden.
> 💬 "You will not be the avenger of a persecuted people. You will be the thing they write into emergency doctrines as
> justification for anything. Everything."
She leans forward a fraction.
> 💬 "You say you don’t care. I don’t entirely believe you. Not about that. Not about children on either side."
She does not plead. She calls your bluff.
> 💬 "You kept your power in check in New York. In Paris. In Tokyo. You are capable of precision."
She flicks a gaze at Andrews, then back to you.
> 💬 "Use it here. Take your people. Take the wolf-kin. Take the others if they choose to go. Leave the villages and towns out of
> it."
There’s no promise attached—no “and we’ll all be good from now on.” Just a hard, ugly trade between horrors.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
⭐ GEN. KOVÁCS | TERMS FROM THE LONG GAME [⭐]
📝 Kovács listens, his face going darker as you lay out strikes and meteors. When Hargreaves finishes, he exhales slowly, then
meets your eyes through the glass.
> 💬 "We do not negotiate with someone holding a gun to our head."
He lets that hang a heartbeat.
> 💬 "We are negotiating with someone who can walk through the gun and then decide whether to pull the trigger anyway."
He doesn’t bother pretending this is normal.
> 💬 "You are right: no western nation took your hand when you offered talks on Tsunejima. I sat in some of those meetings. The
> consensus was that anything we gained in assurance would be outweighed by what you learned about how to hurt us."
He gives a small, bitter smile.
> 💬 "That calculus looks rather stupid now that you are at one of our doors with your data expert already inside."
His fingers tap once on the table.
> 💬 "You say our black sites are shrinking. Good. They should. Some will be shut down because of what you did today. Others will
> be shut down because we cannot cover what has already been done."
He doesn’t overpromise.
> 💬 "But if you start escalating from bases to civilian population centers, you will not just lose whatever moral high ground you
> think you do not have."
His gaze is cold.
> 💬 "You will push this from ‘horrific secret programme’ into ‘justification for global war’. And for all your power, Mr Goodwin,
> there are things a frightened planet can do that even you may not have accounted for."
He doesn’t list them. He doesn’t need to.
> 💬 "So here is what I can offer, and it is not nothing."
He holds up a hand as if to punctuate each point.
> 💬 "One: all non-human detainees in this facility—kitsune, wolf-kin, para-variants—are transferred to your custody today. You
> walk them out under your shield. No shots fired. Two: the eight human detainees are removed to a neutral medical facility under
> independent monitoring. You can place your own observers. Three: this installation’s Level Three operations are shut down and
> audited by an internal allied commission whose findings will not be classified in full."
His eyes narrow.
> 💬 "Four: in return, you leave this structure standing. You do not kill the staff. You do not turn it into a crater, a lava
> lake, or anything that will be visible from orbit. And you cease physical attacks on other suspected facilities for a defined
> interval while we attempt to unwind the mess our ‘frightened men with red folders’ built."
He lets the offer settle.
> 💬 "You will still have your data. Your receipts. Your witnesses. You can come back to the table with us—or with others—waving
> those in our faces."
A tiny shrug.
> 💬 "Or you can refuse, and when the dust settles we will tell our publics that we tried to negotiate and you made a volcano out
> of a hospital."
He doesn’t pretend he likes that line. He just acknowledges it will be used.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🧑‍✈️ COLONEL ANDREWS | IN THE BLAST SHADOW
📝 Andrews doesn’t look at you while Hargreaves and Kovács talk; he looks at the gate, at the guards, at the cameras. At the
little portable terminal that has become the eye of a very dangerous storm.
When Kovács lays out the four points, some tension leaks out of his shoulders—a man who knows that this might be the only way he
walks away without his base becoming a molten memory.
He glances up at you at last.
> 💬 "You asked why you keep finding yourself at places like this,"
he says quietly.
> 💬 "Because people like me kept believing we could control the damage if we kept it out of the daylight."
He meets your gaze squarely.
> 💬 "You’ve dragged it into daylight. Whatever you do next decides how much of the world has to burn before it changes."
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 NARU | WORLD REACTION TICKER [🦊📋]
📝 In the back of your mind, Naru’s presence flickers like a status bar.
> 💬 “Satellites are repositioning. SIGINT nodes are lit up from D.C. to Brussels to Moscow to Beijing.”
Tiny flashes of data stream past your thoughts:
 * 
   Emergency secure calls labeled TSUNEJIMA INCIDENT.
 * 
   Draft talking points about “a limited confrontation at a classified research site.”
 * 
   Two separate war-game sims spinning up with your silhouette as the red force marker.
> 💬 “They are already writing the story in case you turn this place into a hole,”
she notes, dry.
> 💬 “But they are also quietly queuing orders to wind down a few programmes if you don’t.”
A pause.
> 💬 “Whatever you do here, hubby, I can promise you one thing: nobody is going to forget this call.”
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The wind cuts. The beacons pulse.
You’re still smiling.
On the screen:
 * 
   A minister who has finally said the quiet parts out loud.
 * 
   A general offering terms that hurt his side almost as much as they placate yours.
On the ground:
 * 
   A colonel and a line of guards standing exactly where the blast radius would start.
 * 
   A wife with a staff who will follow you into whatever comes next.
 * 
   A journalist and a whistleblower in a fox-made bubble, watching to see whether you’ll be the monster they feared or something
   stranger.

🚧 "BASE ACCESS ROAD – FRONT GATE" | 🌥️ "LOW GREY CLOUD" | 🕑 "AFTERNOON, 14:27" | 📅 "02/12/2061"
SCENE TITLE: MERCY ON CAMERA
Wind howls along the access road, tearing past concrete and razor wire. Red beacons pulse against the grey as the whole base holds
its breath, every eye fixed on the fox who just put the world on speakerphone.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | BROADCAST & BALLAST [🦊🧭]
📝 You uncurl from your invisible bench at last, bare soles kissing the tarmac with a soft tap. The air flexes around you as you
sink your weight into reality for the first time since you arrived.
> 💬 "You see.... the mistake everyone makes about me is they humanise me, try to personify what I am and what I’m thinking... try
> to play to my humanity."
📝 You lift a hand.
With a soft bloop-bloop-bloop of displaced air, thirty fox-eye orbs shimmer into visibility around you in a wide
halo—glass-smooth, lens-black, each one humming with captured light. No one saw them arrive. Not the guards. Not Andrews. Not even
Naru. Not even Ayaka.
> 💬 "While we have been talking and we have all been threatening and, I have been streaming this whole interaction from thirty
> angles to eight billion people around the world.
> 
> I know how these things get shifted, I know how you humans work and how words get twisted, but let me show you what restraint
> and negotiations look like... let me show you what mercy of a god looks like."
📝 The orbs pulse once; somewhere, everywhere, millions of screens flicker from morning news and cooking shows to you.
You flick your hand.
Reality folds.
One moment, Hargreaves and Kovács are in their respective rooms—glass water, paper stacks, aides hovering. The next, they simply
aren’t.
They reappear in front of you with a soft compression pop, coats flaring in the cold, shoes skidding half a step on rough tarmac.
Breath rips from their lungs at the sudden change in pressure and temperature; their eyes go wide as they register:
 * 
   Armed guards frozen mid-aim.
 * 
   The gate.
 * 
   You.
 * 
   The hovering orbs.
Security teams at both their former locations explode into panic as chairs sit empty and comms start screaming.
> 💬 "You see... if world domination was what I wanted... no one would be safe.... but I tire of saying it to the point where I
> should just wipe you all out to prove you right.... but alas.... it’s not my plan."
📝 Above, unseen from the ground but bright on military scopes, a classified Mark 14 surveillance satellite shifts off its orbital
track—something has gripped it.
You raise your hand; your whole body shudders, muscles and mantle straining as you pull.
Cloud cover boils, and then:
The satellite punches through the low grey like a falling cathedral, heat-scorched and brutal—two storeys tall, bristling with
antennae and sensor arrays. It should be a streaking fireball. Instead it slows, dragging a forced, whining gravity behind it
until it comes to a dead, impossible hover high above the facility.
> 💬 "Above us now is a Mark 14 surveillance satellite. Black ops... it’s been watching me and following me for two months now."
Your fingers curl.
The alloy shrieks.
In a single, obscene instant, the bulk of it collapses inward, like paper crushed in an invisible fist. Towers, dishes, tanks,
struts—everything implodes into a matte-black sphere barely larger than a basketball. The tarmac jumps under your feet as its
35-tonne weight thumps down just off to one side, spider-webbing the concrete.
> 💬 "You see, lucky for you all, this is not a NATO satellite, in fact I do not know whose it is."
📝 The ball sits there, a stupidly dense monument to restraint.
> 💬 "Now.... for those of you still watching on screen...."
You let the words hang, smile still wrong on your face, eyes hooded.
The orbs hum softly.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 AYAKA | STORM IN SHOT [🦊🔥]
📝 Ayaka’s ears snap back when the orbs appear—even she didn’t feel them. Her staff haft creaks under her grip when you pull an

When you teleport Hargreaves and Kovács, she shifts half a step, automatically adjusting her stance to cover you from the two new

Her tail brushes your calf once—a silent …and that was you being gentle—before settling, eyes sweeping the perimeter as she feels

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🎖️ MINISTER HARGREAVES | FROM DESK TO TARMAC [🎖️😳]
📝 One heartbeat she’s at her conference table, papers in hand.
Next heartbeat: wind knifes through her suit; the smell of exhaust and cold concrete slaps her. She sucks in a shocked breath,

> 💬 "—what the hell—"

Her political instincts kick in even through the shock; she clamps her mouth shut, jaw locking, because anything she says now is

⭐ GEN. KOVÁCS | IN THE BLAST RADIUS NOW [⭐🧊]
📝 Kovács lands better—years of training make his knees bend automatically as he hits different ground. But the widening of his

> 💬 "And broadcast proof you can do it."
He doesn’t sound impressed. He sounds like a man recalculating every scenario tree with that new node in it.
He glances at the crushed sphere again.
> 💬 "And you call this ‘mercy’."
It’s not a question. It’s an acknowledgment of the knife edge you’re dancing on.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🧑‍✈️ COLONEL ANDREWS | COMMAND AT ARM’S LENGTH [🧑‍✈️😐]
📝 Andrews physically flinches when his bosses blink into existence beside you, taking half a step forward as if he

>

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🌏 ELSEWHERE | THE WORLD WATCHING [🌐👁️]
📝 The orbs sing their feed into every crack of the modern world:
 * 
   In a tiny Tokyo apartment, a student drops his chopsticks as his screen flicks from variety show to live footage of Tsunejima’s
   fox on a military road, a ball of tortured metal beside him.
 * 
   In a NATO situation room, a dozen staffers stand up at once as their secure screens abruptly show their own minister yanked out
   of her chair and onto a foreign tarmac.
 * 
   On Tsunejima, novices and elders crowd around projection walls as Varethyn routes the multi-angle feed through the temple’s
   inner displays—eyes hard, tails lashing.
 * 
   In a darkened living room in the US, a woman recognises the layout of the base more than the people in it, and starts to shake.
Hashtags bloom in real time—some reverent, some terrified, some furious. Censors scramble, but the genie’s out of the bottle and
dancing on twelve different platforms at once.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The access road trembles with the aftershock of your demonstration.
 * 
   Thirty orbs hang in a perfect sphere around you, lenses dilated.
 * 
   A 35-tonne ball of compressed espionage sits like a punctuation mark.
 *

SCENE TITLE: THE LOOK
The quake-hum under the tarmac has faded, leaving only the creak of settling metal, the ragged breathing of hundreds, and the
distant wail of sirens that have no idea what they’re supposed to be warning about anymore.
Eleven bodybags at your feet. Three hundred and fifty humans scattered in a wide ring. One fox at your side, one storm at your
shoulder, a minister and a general behind the bollards—and the whole world watching through thirty unblinking eyes.

off the tarmac by your will. Their yelps cut across each other; arms flail, boots kick at nothing.
You tighten your fingers.
They drop.
Not with bone-breaking force—but hard enough that knees slam stone, breath whooshes from lungs, palms scrape bloody as they catch
themselves at the very edge of your shadow, right beside the line of bodybags.
Doctor Halden’s glasses skid away; his eyes are wide and wet. Major Reece’s jaw is clenched, teeth bared. Director Lawson presses
one hand to the ground, the other to her ribs, trying not to show how much the landing hurt.
Dust eddies around them.
You cut a look sideways to Kaito—a small, sharp flick of your gaze that says, as clearly as words: you don’t have to watch this.
Then you turn.
You face Ayaka.
You’re still smiling, but your eyes… your eyes are almost glassy now, pale and hot, full of hate and grief and a rage that feels
less like fire and more like a shaken bottle of coke—pressure fizzing against glass, seconds from exploding.
📝 Your gaze pins her, begs her.
Not with words, but with that raw mix of:
 * 
   I’m about to do something I cannot take back.
 * 
   Tell me no.
 * 
   Tell me yes.
 * 
   Just—see me.
The orbs catch every tiny tremor in your fingers, every micromovement of your jaw as your power coils, waiting for the direction
of your next thought.

🦊 AYAKA | STORM’S ANSWER [🦊🔥]
📝 Ayaka meets your stare head-on.
For a heartbeat, she doesn’t move at all—just lets it hit her: the bottles of hate and history in your eyes, the three humans
kneeling where you bled, where others died, the eleven zipped-up bags at your feet, the fox you rescued who remembers every name.
Her tail flicks once, sharp. Then she steps forward, into the space between you and the three.
Her staff comes up—not across you, not as a weapon, but planted beside your bare foot, wood kissing cracked tarmac with a solid
tok that feels like a line drawn in the world.
🦊 AYAKA | BETWEEN YOU AND THE DROP [🦊🔥]
> 💬 "Jayson."
📝 Your name is a low, precise note—no thunder, no shout. It cuts straight through the wind and the mumbling of the humans.
She reaches out, fingers brushing the back of your wrist—just enough contact to be felt, not enough to try to stop you by force.
Her eyes never leave yours.
> 💬 "Look at me, not them."
📝 Her ears tip back for a second, seeing the glassy rage, then forward again. She’s not soft; she’s steady.
> 💬 "You are not wrong."
She jerks her chin at the bodybags, at Kaito, at the facility you ripped out of the earth.
> 💬 "They did this. They chose."
A breath.
> 💬 "But if you kill them like this… here… now… you give them exactly what they gave you."
Her thumb moves, a small circle against your skin—grounding, not pleading.
> 💬 "No trial. No truth. Just a gun in the dark."
She glances, briefly, at one of the orbs.
> 💬 "Eight billion are watching. Our people are watching."
Back to you.
> 💬 "If you want justice, take it. Take them. Bring them to Tsunejima. Put them in front of every survivor, every family, make
> them answer, name, hear every thing they did."
Her voice tightens; the storm flickers just behind her eyes.
> 💬 "If you want vengeance…"
She doesn’t say I won’t love you. She doesn’t say I’ll stop you.
> 💬 "…then don’t pretend it’s for them."
She tips her head, forehead nearly touching yours now, forcing your world to narrow to gold eyes, wet hair, and the barest scent
of bath salts and steel.
> 💬 "Say it’s for you."
A beat.
> 💬 "But whatever you decide, husband… do it with your eyes open. Not theirs."
📝 Her hand stays on your wrist, not tightening, not dragging—just there, a last anchor offered before you either pull away… or
let it hold.
Behind her, Halden, Reece, and Lawson are breathing too fast, caught between terror of you and a surreal, awful understanding that
a fox wife is the only thing between them and something they can’t name.
Kaito has turned his head to the side, ears folded, staring at a crack in the tarmac. He heard your silent permission; he takes
it.
Hargreaves and Kovács stand still by the bollards, watching a god look at his wife for an answer their doctrines don’t have words
for.
The orbs hang in a perfect sphere, recording the moment where your fingers either unclench…
…or don’t.

🚧 "BASE ACCESS ROAD – FRONT GATE" | 🌥️ "LOW GREY CLOUD" | 🕟 "AFTERNOON, 14:37" | 📅 "02/12/2061"
SCENE TITLE: SENTENCING, DEFERRED
The wind scrapes along cracked tarmac, catching on the edges of the crushed satellite sphere and the zipper seams of eleven
bodybags. Thirty fox-eye orbs hang in silent orbit, broadcasting every flinch and breath to a world that can’t look away.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | SENTENCE ON LIVE FEED [🦊🧭]
📝 You flick your fingers and tear space open behind you again—another portal to temple stone, its frame humming with Tsunejima’s
air. Halden, Reece, and Lawson jerk up under your power, dragged off their knees and suspended in a tight, invisible grip in front
of you.
Their hands claw at nothing. Boots kick. Throats choke around strangled sounds.
Your voice, when it comes, is cold as the wind.
> 💬 "When everyone else is done with you, and they have taken what they need from you, you will be fed to the wolfkin on the
> island for the 11 lives you took and god knows how many before that."
📝 The words land like stones in water—ripples of horror, satisfaction, disbelief spreading through humans and foxes alike.
Before any of them can form a reply, you rip your hand back.
The three whip through the air as if yanked on a chain, bodies snapping backward into the portal in a blur of limbs and choked
cries. You don’t paste them; you hurt them—bones will be cracked, ribs bruised, breath shattered—but they are very much alive when
they vanish from the base’s sky… and slam into Tsunejima’s.
The portal shudders, view swinging; you drag the frame sideways with a thought until it shows the med wing instead. In one smooth
motion, you sweep Kaito and the remaining rescue, along with the eleven bodybags, through behind them, depositing fox and dead
gently on polished stone amidst scrambling healers and wide-eyed temple guards.
Then you close your hand.
The portal seals with a soft fwump, cutting off the scent of incense and fox and replacing it with exhaust and cold concrete
again.
You turn back to the access road.
Your eyes have gone full star—blue suns, burning in hollow sockets. Tears spill down your cheeks, but they are not water; they
sizzle as they fall, each drop hissing against the tarmac and leaving tiny blackened pits. Your nine tails flare behind you in a
corona of white-hot light, edges fuzzed by heat haze.
For a heartbeat, you look less like a fox and more like something that crawled out of the space between stars and put on a body as
a courtesy.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 AYAKA | THE LINE SHE HOLDS [🦊🔥]
📝 Ayaka doesn’t step back when you ignite.
The heat from your tails wavers the air; the plasma in your tears sends little curls of smoke up between you. She squints
slightly, eyes watering, but she doesn’t move her hand from your wrist.
Her ears flick once at the words “fed to the wolfkin.” You feel the flinch in the brief tightening of her fingers—Lysera will have
thoughts about that, and so will the wolves under Tsunejima’s banner—but she doesn’t correct you in front of eight billion people.
Instead, she shifts her grip, sliding her hand down to lace her fingers with yours.
📝 Her staff remains planted beside your bare foot, a grounding post in scorched stone.
> 💬 "You chose not to kill them,"
she murmurs in Kitsune, quiet enough that the mics barely catch it.
> 💬 "You sent them to us."
Her thumb strokes once over the back of your hand—tiny, invisible to most of the world, but enough to say: I saw what you didn’t
do, as much as what you did.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 TEMPLE – GUARDS & WOLVES [🐺🛡️]
📝 On Tsunejima, three broken humans slam into existence in a charmed impact zone just inside the portal line—hard enough to break
ribs, maybe, but not necks.
Temple guards wheel in reflex, spears and staves lifting, then hesitate as they recognise who they’ve just been handed:
 * 
   One doctor.
 * 
   One execution squad commander.
 * 
   One director.
All of them groaning, gasping, blinking up at foxes who have seen the other side of their kind’s work.
> 💬 "Restrain them,"
comes Varethyn’s voice from off-camera, clipped and calm.
Bindings go on—layered wards woven through physical restraints. There will be no accidents here.
In another wing, Lysera lifts her head from where she’s helping settle a trembling wolf-kin girl onto a med bed, ears flattening
as Naru’s replay feeds your “fed to the wolfkin” line into a side screen.
Her lips peel back, just a fraction; her tail lashes once.
> 💬 "We are not carrion birds,"
she mutters under her breath.
But she keeps working—steady paws, soft voice—knowing the conversation about what justice looks like for wolves and foxes both
will come later.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🧑‍✈️ COLONEL ANDREWS | GOD IN FULL RADIANCE [🧑‍✈️😨]
📝 Back on the access road, Andrews has to shield his eyes for a second as your tails flare fully. The heat shimmers across his
vision; the image of plasma tears burning pits in the tarmac is something he knows will show up in his dreams—if he ever sleeps
properly again.
> 💬 "All personnel—"
he starts into his mic, voice cracking slightly, then steadies.
> 💬 "—remain where you are. Do not engage. Do not raise weapons."
He doesn’t bother adding unless you want to find out what those tears feel like when they hit bone.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🎖️ MINISTER HARGREAVES | BROADCAST CONTRITION [🎖️]
📝 Hargreaves stares at you—at the tears that burn, at the tails that halo you, at the eleven bags and the scorch-spotted road—and
feels a deep, sick lurch at the knowledge that this is what their “special programmes” have dragged into the open air.
She takes a step forward, only one, putting herself a fraction more in frame.
She doesn’t address you first. She addresses the nearest orb.
> 💬 "To those watching,"
her voice carries, roughened,
> 💬 "you have just seen what was never meant to be seen. This facility. Those bodies. Those… names."
She swallows once.
> 💬 "On behalf of my government, I will not ask you to forgive it. Only to understand that this is not madness in a vacuum. It is
> the consequence of fear, secrecy, and a refusal to treat Tsunejima as a nation instead of a threat to be… dissected."
Her gaze flicks to you, then back to the invisible audience.
> 💬 "The three he just removed will face judgment under Tsunejima’s eyes. The rest will face ours. You have my word that there
> will be no quiet transfers, no hidden burials."
Her jaw tightens.
> 💬 "You can hold me to that. You are already watching."
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
⭐ GEN. KOVÁCS | RECALCULATING DOCTRINE [⭐]
📝 Kovács doesn’t try to speak over Hargreaves. He waits, watching your burning tears pit the road.
When she falls quiet, he speaks without stepping forward—voice level, eyes like iron.
> 💬 "For those in uniform watching this,"
he says, clearly addressing every soldier glued to a screen anywhere,
> 💬 "understand what just happened here."
He gestures, small, to the eleven bags, the empty circle where the three once knelt.
> 💬 "An enemy we are not equipped to fight by force has chosen—today—not to tear this place off the map. He has taken evidence
> and suspects into his custody and left the rest of us standing."
His gaze shifts to you for a beat.
> 💬 "We will treat this as both a catastrophe and a… window."
He chooses the word like it tastes bad.
> 💬 "There will be no more pretending that programmes like this can be contained. There will be no more comfort in the notion
> that the things done in Level Three stay in Level Three."
He doesn’t promise miracles. He doesn’t promise the end of all black sites.
He promises that the myth of secrecy just died on live broadcast.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🧑‍💻 SOPHIE & 🧑‍💼 GARETH | THE WORLD’S EYES [📺]
📝 Sophie’s hands are shaking so badly now that her current notes look like seismograph readouts, but she can’t stop.
> 💬 "He didn’t kill them,"
she says, half to herself, half to the recording app open on her tablet.
> 💬 "He could have, in front of everyone. Instead he just handed them to the people they tortured and threatened to feed them to
> wolves."
She glances at Ayaka, then at your burning tears.
> 💬 "And his wife still held his hand."
Gareth watches you, his own eyes wet.
> 💬 "If they get eaten,"
he says quietly,
> 💬 "they’ll have seen it coming a lot longer than the ones they put in front of firing squads."
He doesn’t sound sure whether that comforts or horrifies him.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 NARU | METRICS OF A GOD’S RESTRAINT [🦊📋]
📝 In the back of your mind, Naru’s presence hums, more sober now.
> 💬 “Global feeds are going to be replaying the phrase ‘fed to the wolfkin’ for weeks.”
A faint, wry note.
> 💬 “Lysera already pinged me. We’ll have to talk about that when you’re home.”
More seriously:
> 💬 “But the numbers are clear, Jayson. You just showed them you can drop satellites, rip open bases, and still… not kill
> everyone in reach. That scares them.”
A pause.
> 💬 “It also means the ones who want this to stop now have proof you’re willing to negotiate with something other than craters.”
There’s quiet pride under the dry tone.
> 💬 “Come home when you’re done. We’ve got twenty-three foxes, three wolves, and eleven families who need you more than any of
> these humans do.”
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The road smells of scorched stone and fear.
 * 
   The facility is back in its grave.
 * 
   The bodies are at your feet.
 * 
   The guilty three are wounded but alive, now under fox guard.
 * 
   Hundreds of humans kneel or sit or stand, watching a god cry plasma.
 * 
   A minister and a general have had their feet shoved onto the same ground as those they once called “assets.”
 * 
   Your wife’s fingers are still laced with yours.
The orbs keep spinning.
Whatever you say—or don’t say—next will echo far beyond this tarmac.

SCENE TITLE: THE MARK
Dust hangs like smoke above the cracked tarmac. The crushed satellite ball squats in its web of fractures. Thirty orbs hum in the
grey, feeding every heartbeat and breath to a world that can’t look away.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | MERCY WITH TEETH [🦊🧭]
📝 You lift your hand one last time.
Light condenses at your fingertips—razor-thin, curved, like slivers of a shattered star. With a flick, they explode outward in a
silent halo.
Each shard finds a target.
Every human on the tarmac jerks as a needle of light spears their forehead for a fraction of a heartbeat—no blood, just a sharp
sting behind the eyes—then they all drop as if strings were cut. Knees slam, palms scrape, a few skulls thud against tarmac and
gravel. Groans chorus across the road.
> 💬 "you have been marked. what this mark does, is if you commit any crimes in your life from here on out, you so much as steal a
> paperclip that does not belong to you, you will die, and it will be long, and painful.
> 
> 
> live your life in peace.... consider this my mercy for those who I do not think deserve it. the mark will read intent, so there
> will be no accidental deaths...."
📝 The words roll over them like a curse carved into bone.

> 💬 "dont cross my path again in this way.... I will not show restrain a second time."
📝 Heads bow, some in terror, some in numb shock. A few hands fly to foreheads as if they could scrape the mark off.
You turn to Ayaka, eyes twin blue suns, but say nothing—just hold her gaze for a breath, letting her see the shape of the thing
you’ve just done.
Then you pivot, tails flared, and look straight into the orbiting orbs—the eyes of the world.
Your hand comes up, finger stabbing toward Sophie and Gareth in their bubble.
> 💬 "as for these 2 people..."

> 💬 "i will be watching them, if anything other than a normal life happens to them, mark my words.... I will.... kill.... all who
> are involved."
📝 Sophie pales; Gareth goes very still. Somewhere behind a dozen government firewalls, risk officers start quietly updating whole
threat models around the words normal life.
You turn away from the ring of humans, from the satellite ball, from eleven zipped bags and one scarred fox still kneeling by
them.
You take Ayaka’s hand.
Space folds at your feet, reality puckering like fabric pinched between fingers. The air pops once; a vertical line of nothing
opens in front of you, soft light bleeding around its edges.
You step into it with Ayaka—and, with a twitch of your fingers, Sophie and Gareth are yanked up onto their feet and swept along,
dragged in your wake before they can do more than gasp.
The portal snaps shut behind you, leaving:
 * 
   A cracked, scorched access road.
 * 
   Hundreds of humans clutching their foreheads, trying not to think about paperclips.
 * 
   A minister and a general staring at the empty space where you stood.
 * 
   Thirty orbs spinning in the air a moment longer before they wink out, one by one, feeds cutting back to stunned anchors and
   scrolling emergency graphics.
The mark hums unseen in every skull you touched, ticking quietly into their futures.

🏯 "TSUNEJIMA – HEALING HALL" | 🌧️ "SOFT ISLAND RAIN" | 🌆 "EVENING, 18:47" | 📅 "02/12/2061"
SCENE TITLE: ELEVEN
Lantern-light hushes the stone hall in warm gold. Rain patters steady on the outer eaves, a heartbeat behind the low murmur of
healers. Incense is a faint thread under sharper smells—salve, blood, fear, metal. Outside, the island’s soul presses close, quiet
and listening.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | EMPTIED ORBIT [🦊🧭]
📝 You guide Ayaka forward with a gentle press, nudging her toward the cluster of healers and the shaken foxes and wolves, then
let your hand fall away. Your feet leave the stone in that familiar, weightless hover as you drift back a step and stop at the
head of the row.
Eleven bodies lie on low platforms now, no bags—clean cloths drawn up to their chests, ears smoothed, fingers uncurled. Old scars,
fresh bruises, and the stillness of too-long silence.
You hang there, just above the floor, hands loose at your sides, tails low and heavy. You simply look down at them. No jokes. No
words. Just that long, unblinking stare that makes the lantern light seem too loud.
> > 💭 It should have been fewer.
The thought is there and gone like a heat shimmer, swallowed by the stone.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 AYAKA | HANDS WHERE THEY’RE NEEDED [🦊🔥]
📝 Ayaka lets you steer her forward, then peels away without argument. She moves among the living—checking pupils, adjusting
blankets, murmuring in low Kitsune and Japanese, her staff a quiet anchor at the edge of beds.
Her ears twitch once in your direction, tracking your silence, but she doesn’t break from the wounded. One palm rests between a
trembling fox’s shoulder blades as he sobs without sound; another hand adjusts an IV line for a wolf-kin woman whose eyes follow
you across the hall.
> 💬 "Breathe,"
she whispers to them, not to you.
> 💬 "He brought you home. Let us do the rest."
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 VARETHYN | QUIET PERIMETER [🦊🕯️]
📝 Varethyn stands a few paces off your shoulder, just outside the line of the eleven. Her mantle is dimmed low, veilmarks a soft
ember glow at her throat and wrists. She doesn’t crowd you; she simply holds space—one tail-tip almost, almost touching the edge
of your nearest, but not quite.
Her eyes track your face, then drop to the dead, then back again.
> 💬 "We have names for all of them,"
she says softly, more report than comfort.
> 💬 "Families for ten. One… we will need to search."
📝 She doesn’t ask you to look at her. She doesn’t ask you to speak. She just stays there, a lighthouse set a few metres off your
storm.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🐺 LYSERA | HEARING THE SENTENCE [🐺🌫️]
📝 At the far end of the hall, Lysera moves between wolf-kin beds—broad shoulders hunched slightly against the human word that’s
already reached her: fed to the wolfkin.
Her ears are flat, but her touch is gentle on a younger wolf’s bandaged arm. When her gaze slides down the hall and catches your
hovering form over the eleven, some of the tightness in her jaw eases; this is not a fox untouched by what he’s done.
> 💬 "No one feeds carrion to my pack,"
she murmurs to herself, too low for most to hear.
> > 📜 Wolves of Tsunejima have their own codes; meat is for the hunt, not for old hate.
📝 For now, she lets the words sit; the argument can wait until grief has had its first pass.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 NARU | SIGNALS SOFTENING [🦊📋]
📝 From a side alcove, Naru stands with an armpad folded against her chest, feed windows hovering and dim. The data storm is still
there—worldwide reaction graphs, clipped speeches, military chatter—but she’s muted it down to a whisper.
Her gaze tracks from the charts to you, then to the eleven.
> 💬 "Global feeds are looping the moment you bowed to Varethyn,"
she says lightly, as if talking about weather.
> 💬 "And the eleven."
She doesn’t mention the mark, or the threat about paperclips, or wolfkin. Not right now.
> 💬 "I archived everything. When you’re ready."
📝 She leaves it open-ended, not a request, not a demand—just a marker laid quietly at the edge of your silence.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 SHION | SHADOW AT THE LINTEL [🦊🌑]
📝 Shion is a darker outline in the doorway, half in, half out, like a shadow that hasn’t decided whether it belongs in this room.
Her eyes flick from the dead to the living to you.
Her ears twitch once; her hand tightens momentarily on the hilt at her hip—not in threat, but in the restless way of someone who
kills in the dark and has just watched you do it in brighter ways.
She doesn’t speak.
She holds her silence with you, a second still shape at the edge of lamplight.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The rain keeps tapping on the eaves.
The island’s soul presses against the foundation stones like a child trying to understand why “safe” sometimes still means “too
late.”
Ayaka’s voice threads through the hall in soft, practical instructions.
Varethyn stands her quiet watch.
Lysera and the wolves keep vigil over their own.
Naru and Shion bracket the room’s edges.
And you hover above eleven restored faces, staring down in a silence the whole temple has learned not to interrupt.

🏯 "TSUNEJIMA – HEALING HALL" | 🌧️ "SOFT ISLAND RAIN" | 🌆 "EVENING, 18:52" | 📅 "02/12/2061"
SCENE TITLE: NAMES, FACES, TEETH
Lanterns burn low and steady, their light soft against white-washed walls and pale stone. Rain drums on the outer eaves, a quiet,
constant percussion. The air is thick with incense, herbs, and the metallic ghost of blood.
Eleven foxes lie in a row—no bags now, just bodies, just silence.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | GLASS-EDGED [🦊🧭]
📝 You hover at the head of the line, tails low and heavy, eyes still too bright for the gentle light of the hall. The words come
out almost casually, just above the hush and the rain.
> 💬 "Akohimu, he had no family, lived on his own."
📝 You don’t explain. You don’t look at Varethyn to see her reaction. You just raise your hand.
Power spills out in a slow, shimmering wash, not the tearing kind from the base but something softer—threads of pale blue-gold
that settle over each of the eleven like a second skin. Bruises fade. Split lips knit. Bullet furrows smooth. Burn-scars ease. Fur
lies neat, ears uncrumple, fingers relax from death’s last clench.
In less than a breath, they look like they fell asleep mid-story. No more steel tables. No more Level Three.
You still don’t look at Lysera when you speak again.
> 💬 "I was going to give them to Rava and her pack for sport."
📝 The word sport hangs in the warm air like a dropped knife.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 VARETHYN | LEDGER KEEPER [🦊🕯️]
📝 Varethyn’s eyes flick to the third from the end as you name him.
> 💬 "Akohimu,"
she repeats quietly, committing it to the inner ledger where she keeps every fox who’s come under her temple roof—living or dead.
Her gaze softens for half a breath at the sight of the mended bodies. This is closer to the death rites she was bred for, less
butchered meat, more… kin.
> 💬 "Then he will have us,"
she answers, just as soft.
📝 When you speak of Rava and “sport,” her veilmarks pulse once—a small, warning flare—and her eyes slide toward Lysera even as
her posture remains carefully, deliberately neutral.
This is not her argument to start.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🐺 LYSERA | TEETH AND LINES [🐺🌫️]
📝 The word sport hits Lysera like a slap.
Her ears snap forward, then flatten; hackles lift in a visible ripple under her robes. She straightens from the bed she’s been
tending, yellow eyes narrowing on you even though you still refuse to look her way.
A beat of silence, thick as fur and steel.
Then she steps closer—into your peripheral vision, but not into your personal space. The lantern-light catches on the faint old
scars along her jaw, the ones Rava’s pack left there in the days before Tsunejima.
> 💬 "We are wolves,"
she says, voice low but hard enough to carry down the row.
> 💬 "Not arenas."
📝 Her tail lashes once, then stills by force of will.
> 💬 "Rava does not hunt ‘for sport,’ Jayson. When you brought her those three—"
> > 📜 The traitors from Chapter 73: human architects of cages and frost, thrown to the pack at the edge of permafrost.
> 💬 "—you called it judgment. You named their crimes. You watched until it was done."
Her gaze slices briefly to the eleven peaceful faces, then back to you.
> 💬 "If you ever bring her more, it will not be as toys."
There’s no outright challenge in her stance; she knows what you are, what you did today. But there is a clear, unambiguous line:
Wolves are not your circus.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 AYAKA | BETWEEN FOX AND FANG [🦊🔥]
📝 Ayaka pauses halfway through re-wrapping a bandage on a wolf-kin’s arm when you say sport. Her ears flick toward Lysera’s
voice; her mouth tightens just for a moment.
She doesn’t jump in. Not yet.
Her hands keep working, fingers gentle and precise.
> 💬 "Easy,"
she murmurs to the patient beneath her touch.
> 💬 "He is speaking from anger, not law."
📝 The words are for the shaking wolf-kin girl, but the look she flicks your way says she’s hoping you hear them too.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 NARU | FILE NOTE [🦊📋]
📝 Naru’s armpad pings softly as she adds a new tag to a growing cluster of data:
> RAVA–PACK–JUSTICE PROTOCOLS: clarify distinction between execution, hunt, ‘sport’
She doesn’t say it aloud, but there’s a faint sigh in the link between you.
> 💬 "You know Lysera’s right,"
her mental voice threads in, dry but not unkind.
> 💬 "We don’t throw our monsters to hers because we’re bored. We do it because sometimes wolves are the only ones who know how to
> tear that kind of rot out by the root."
A beat.
> 💬 "Talk to her later. Preferably when you’re not still leaking star tears on the floor."
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 SHION | SHADOW VERDICT [🦊🌑]
📝 Shion’s eyes track the magic as you mend the dead, taking in every softened wound, every erased bruise.
At the mention of Rava and sport, one ear twitches; the corner of her mouth tightens.
> 💬 "Rava hunts traitors,"
she says quietly from the doorway, more to the air than to you.
> 💬 "Not… toys."
📝 It’s as much agreement with Lysera as you’ll ever get out of her in public. She lets it hang there, then folds her arms back
into her sleeves, watching to see whether you bristle… or bend.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The rain keeps drumming on the eaves.
Eleven foxes lie as if they might wake any moment and complain about the incense.
Your power has smoothed their bodies back into something their families can touch without seeing how they died.
You’ve admitted, without quite apologising, how close you came to turning three humans into a different kind of hunt.
And the wolves who once answered that call have made it quietly, firmly clear:
They are not here for your sport, even when your rage whispers that they should be.

🏯 "TSUNEJIMA – HEALING HALL" | 🌧️ "SOFT ISLAND RAIN" | 🌆 "EVENING, 18:57" | 📅 "02/12/2061"
SCENE TITLE: BUBBLES
The rain has gone from patter to hush, a softer drum on the eaves. Lanternlight pools around stone and fur; incense curls in lazy
twists toward the beams. The air is thick with the quiet of too many people trying not to breathe too loudly.
Above each of the eleven, bubbles drift into being at your gesture—small, translucent spheres that catch and refract the lantern
light.
Inside them, memories play:
 * 
   A fox laughing, flour on his nose, in a cramped human kitchen.
 * 
   Another sprinting through snow, tails streaming, breath white in the air.
 * 
   Hands tied to a table.
 * 
   Muzzle flashes.
 * 
   The moment each of them realised the room had shrunk to their last heartbeat.
They replay and overlap, a ghost chorus floating over still bodies.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | TOO MUCH SIGNAL [🦊🧭]
📝 You hover there, motionless except for the way the hall’s faint drafts ruffle the fur along your arms and the ends of your
tails. Eyes fixed on the bubbles, you speak, voice low enough that it feels like you’re talking to the stone as much as to anyone
else.
> 💬 "I wish I had a moral high ground I could rely on like you guys do"
📝 The line lands heavy; nobody rushes to contradict it.
The bubbles above the dead flicker as more scenes cross them—small kindnesses, petty cruelties, the mundane, the monstrous.
> 💬 "The problem when you have so much raw power is that nothing is filtered. I see the past, the present and many of the
> possible futures of every life form that comes within 20feet of me at all times. The moment these bodies landed before me, I saw
> and felt everything."
📝 The admission sits in the air like static. A couple of novices at the far end glance involuntarily at you, as if suddenly
wondering what you have seen and felt of them since they entered the hall.
You fall quiet for a beat, then speak again—still not looking at Lysera.
> 💬 "It was never about using you as tools or toys or arenas. It was about using the nobility if the hunt to release those three
> into the woods to be tracked down and eaten... not instantly vaporised by me. I want them to feel the same things these 11 felt
> that moment they realised their times were up...."
📝 You finally lift your head, eyes sweeping the hall—Varethyn, Ayaka, Lysera, Naru, Shion, healers, survivors—catching each of
them in turn.
> 💬 "because I dont see why I should feel their pain, fear and silence while they get the easy way out."
📝 Then your gaze drops back to the bubbles. One shows a fox’s last look at a fluorescent ceiling; another, the split second
between a trigger pull and impact.
In a single, fluid motion, you pivot toward the exit, tails dragging light behind them like afterimages.
> 💬 "I meant no disrespect Lysera......."
📝 Your voice trails a little on the last word, swallowed by the stone as you move.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🐺 LYSERA | TEETH TO WORDS [🐺🌫️]
📝 Lysera watches you turn, jaw working like she’s tasting air she doesn’t like.
As you pass the line of beds and the wolf-kin you helped bring home, she steps just enough into your path that your shoulder will
brush the edge of her aura when you go by, but not enough to block the door.
Her voice is low, roughened, but clear.
> 💬 "I know you didn’t."
📝 Her ears dip once, acknowledging the explanation you gave without letting you off its hook.
> 💬 "The hunt is noble because it is clean."
Her gaze flicks up to one of the bubbles—a fox running in snow—and then to another, a muzzle flash, a flinch.
> 💬 "What they did was not."
She tips her chin toward the door, toward somewhere that is not this room full of dead and nearly-dead.
> 💬 "When you want them to feel what these eleven felt, that is not the hunt. That is…"
She searches for the word, settles on one that clearly tastes wrong in her mouth.
> 💬 "…torment."
Her shoulders roll back, the alpha settling over her like a mantle.
> 💬 "If Rava runs them, it will be because they must be removed—as a rot, not as entertainment."
Her tail gives one sharp flick.
> 💬 "We’ll talk about it when you can stand here without drowning in everyone’s last breath."
📝 She steps aside then, giving you your path to the door, but not taking her eyes off your back until you’re past.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 AYAKA | COUNTERWEIGHT [🦊🔥]
📝 Ayaka has gone quiet, one hand resting on the rail of a bed, thumb tracing circles against the wood. Her ears are angled
slightly toward you even as her eyes stay on the fox in front of her, whose own gaze is fixed on the bubble showing a childhood
game under human streetlights.
> 💬 "We are not on a high place, Jayson,"
she says, voice soft, but pitched to carry enough that it will find you as you approach the door.
> 💬 "We are standing in the same mud as you."
She glances up at one of your bubbles—at a bad memory, then at a good one.
> 💬 "The difference is… you feel the river under it as well."
Her tail twitches, like a candle flame in a draft.
> 💬 "Let us be your filters. That’s what family is for."
She doesn’t turn fully; she just lets the words hang there for you to either catch or leave behind as you go.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 VARETHYN | BEARING WITNESS [🦊🕯️]
📝 Varethyn’s eyes track the bubbles with quiet intensity. Each running scene reflects across her irises—little ghosts of lives
she should have been guarding long before they ever saw a human lab.
As you move toward the exit, she shifts just enough that your lines of sight meet for a heartbeat.
> 💬 "Moral high ground,"
she says drily, veilmarks pulsing faintly,
> 💬 "is usually just… higher ground. Easier to see where the rocks are."
Her lips twitch in a ghost of that dry, precise humour she rarely uses.
> 💬 "We still fall off it. Often."
She inclines her head, a tiny bow that acknowledges both your choice not to paste the three and the mark you branded into every
human skull back at the base.
> 💬 "You don’t owe us a clean conscience, Jayson."
A breath.
> 💬 "You do owe yourself less of this alone."
She doesn’t move to stop you. She just lets those last words follow you out.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 NARU | LOGGING THE STORM [🦊📋]
📝 Naru’s fingers dance a brief sequence on her armpad; several of the memory bubbles quietly record themselves into long-term
storage, tagged with names and timestamps. The worst of the Level Three footage, she leaves to the echo chamber you’ve made above
the dead.
> 💬 "For what it’s worth,"
she says, aiming for light but not quite making it,
> 💬 "the mark you gave those humans?… statistically going to cause a precipitous drop in petty theft, tax fraud, and war crimes."
Her mouth quirks.
> 💬 "Annoying, for them. Useful, for us."
She sobers.
> 💬 "I can build you filters,"
she adds, gently.
> 💬 "Not for what you feel. But for when, and how much."
She flicks her eyes toward the doorway you’re heading for.
> 💬 "When you want them."
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 SHION | SHADOW TRAILING [🦊🌑]
📝 Shion’s gaze has been fixed on the bubbles, on the way good and bad and terminal moments all jostle in the same sphere over
each head.
As you move toward the door, she slips out of the shadow of the lintel, giving you a silent half-nod as you pass—a warrior’s
acknowledgement to another who’s just come back from a field no one else here has walked.
> 💬 "If you need somewhere with fewer minds,"
she says, voice barely above a whisper,
> 💬 "I can find you a roof."
It’s Shion-code for I’ll sit with you somewhere high and quiet and not ask you to talk.
She doesn’t follow unless you let her; she just leaves the offer on the stones behind your heels.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The bubbles continue to drift over the eleven, replaying lives in loops of light and shadow.
The living are wrapped, tended, spoken to.
The wolves hold their line about what the hunt is and isn’t.
Your wives, in their different ways, throw ropes toward the part of you that’s still hovering above eleven last breaths.
Whether you take any of them now, or later, or not at all—that choice follows you out into the rain as you leave the healing hall
behind.
TAGS: [000182]

🏯 "TSUNEJIMA – HEALING HALL → COURTYARD" | 🌧️➡️🌤️ "RAIN FADING, SUN BREAKING" | 🌇 "EVENING, 19:02" | 📅 "02/12/2061"
SCENE TITLE: THE SLAP
The rain thins to a mist, light slipping through in soft, golden beams. In the healing hall, lanterns glow warm against stone;
beyond the doors, the courtyard is a blur of wet flagstones and steaming roofs, sunlight dripping through like honey.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | EXPLAINING THE UNFILTERED [🦊🧭]
📝 You pause at the threshold, one hand resting lightly against the frame, tails low and trailing faint motes of light.
> 💬 "You misunderstandings, I didnt mean morals in that sense, I meant you all have worked your lives for good and bad, right and
> wrong and when the time comes you can make moral discussions. I can not when I see what I see."
📝 Another small sweep of your hand, and the bubbles over the eleven shiver, brightening slightly, scenes sharpening.
> 💬 "If you truly want to know what it's like, and think you can stomach the feeling of death while being alive. Place an open
> palm on any one if their heads, and you will see and feel all of it.... then you will understand why although I know you are
> willing..... I am not, to give you that."
You glance toward Naru’s corner.
> 💬 "And Naru... even my own stuff can not filter without breaking.... but thank you for wanting to."
📝 Finally, you turn to the shadow at the lintel.
> 💬 "You can understand this, when you read several pages of a book and realise you have no idea what you read and have to read
> it again. That is what most of this is like.... I read it but dont.... it's the dead that slap me."
📝 With that, you step out, leaving the lantern light behind. Warm, damp air greets you; the first shafts of sun push through the
thinning clouds, laying soft gold along your fur as you rise into your familiar hover over the courtyard stones.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 VARETHYN | NOT TAKING THE OFFER [🦊🕯️]
📝 Varethyn watches you at the doorway, head tilted slightly, veilmarks glimmering low.
When you offer them the palm-on-head glimpse, her eyes move, just once, to the nearest of the eleven—then back up.
Her hand tightens on the back of a nearby chair.
> 💬 "No,"
she says simply, more to herself than to you.
> 💬 "We are not meant to be altars."
📝 It’s not refusal out of fear; it’s refusal because someone in this hall has to remain capable of making those “moral decisions”
without bleeding to death on the inside.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 AYAKA | CHOOSING ONE BURDEN [🦊🔥]
📝 Ayaka’s ears twitch at your explanation; her hand pauses where it rests on a patient’s shoulder.
She looks up at the nearest bubble—at a fox laughing under human city lights—and then down at the head beneath it.
For a moment, she looks like she might move.
Her fingers curl instead.
> 💬 "You carry it,"
she says quietly, to the empty doorway where you stood.
> 💬 "I will carry you."
📝 She doesn’t step to the bodies. She steps closer to the living, re-wetting cloth, smoothing ears, letting the dead’s ghosts
remain above their own chests rather than in her spine.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🐺 LYSERA | RESPECTING THE LINE [🐺🌫️]
📝 Lysera stares at the nearest fox’s head when you make the offer, jaw tight. The idea of laying her paw down, of feeling what
they felt, flickers across her face.
She looks at the wolf-kin girl beside her—the one staring at the bubble of her own last moments before rescue—and makes her
choice.
> 💬 "No need,"
she rumbles.
> 💬 "I have enough ghosts already."
📝 There’s no challenge now, just a rough acknowledgement that what you live with is a different kind of hunt entirely—and that
she will not compete with it for who hurts more.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 NARU | LOGGING WHAT SHE CAN’T FIX [🦊📋]
📝 Naru’s lips twitch at your comment about filters breaking.
> 💬 "I’ll file that under ‘attempted husband maintenance, failed gracefully’,"
she murmurs.
Her eyes linger a long moment on the bubbles.
She does not move toward them.
Instead, she lifts a hand to her armpad and dials away most of the global feeds, leaving only a few key windows
hovering—Varethyn’s trial plans, refugee placement charts, med bay supply levels.
> 💬 "I’ll work around the edges, then,"
she says softly, more to the room than to you.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 SHION | UNDERSTANDING IN SHORTHAND [🦊🌑]
📝 Shion’s gaze follows you as you speak, her head tipping just a fraction at the “book pages” analogy.
> 💬 "And the dead are the lines your eyes trip on,"
she answers, almost under her breath.
Her mouth crooks in something that isn’t quite a smile.
> 💬 "Yeah. I get that."
📝 She doesn’t take a step toward the eleven. She doesn’t need to; her nights are already full enough. Instead, when you head out
into the courtyard, she ghosts after you at a respectful distance, becoming just another stretch of shadow along the colonnade.
If you want the roof, she’ll find it.
If you want to be alone, she knows how to disappear.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🌴 THE ISLAND | CHILD LEARNING GENTLENESS [🌊🌀]
📝 As you step into the courtyard, the air wraps you in warmth—humid, rain-soaked, laced with jasmine and sea salt. The island’s
soul nudges at you, tentative and careful this time, its touch like cool fingers on overheated skin.
No sudden grabs. No teleporting you where you can’t breathe.
Just a quiet, wordless:
> You are here.
> I am here.
> We are still together.
📝 Sunlight breaks through the last veil of cloud, casting long, soft shadows over the temple stones and turning your fur into a
muted halo.
For a moment, the only things you feel are:
 *

 *

 *

 *

 *

 *

 *

The stone stays warm under your hovering feet.

“…tell us first next time, and for the love of all tails, tie your robe.”

 *

SCENE TITLE: THE PART WHERE HE STANDS BACK UP
The dust slowly settles, turning the headlight beams into thick, pale pillars. Engines idle in a ragged chorus. The mountains are
nothing but jagged shadows on the horizon, the sky a black bowl pricked with cold stars.
In the middle of the road, under the harsh splash of jeep spotlights, your pieces lie scattered like someone dropped a god and it
shattered.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | REASSEMBLY [🦊🧭]
📝 It starts as a twitch—one fragment of you giving a small, rubbery jerk toward another.
Then another.
Then everything moves.
Your torn parts begin sliding, dragging, stretching toward each other across dirt and gravel like thick, glowing rubber bands,
leaving faint luminous streaks where they pass. Fingers find wrist. Tail-ends slurp back toward their bases. A chunk of chest
pulls itself along the road with obscene determination until it clicks into place with the rest of your torso.
Soldiers stare, frozen, as the mess in the spotlights knits back together in seconds—bones reforming under skin, robe fragments
re-weaving themselves enough to at least hang off you.
In one liquid, squelching rush, you are whole again.
You rise.
You stand there in the middle of the road, back to them, dust drifting around your ankles.
> 💬 "Fucking hell… really? Was that necessary?"
📝 Your voice carries easily in the sudden silence.
You hover an inch off the dirt, turning slowly to face them, robes scorched and torn, fur patched with dust and faint
scorch-marks. Bullet-holes in you close with lazy, simmering light, leaving only the echo of pain behind your ribs.
Your eyes are bright, tired, and very done.
> 💬 "You are lucky before I came here I had a bit of a release moment and feel better, but fire another round and I WILL… eat
> you…."
📝 The words hang there, heavy as the desert heat you’re not actually in. The threat isn’t loud; it’s almost conversational. That
makes it worse.
You let the silence stretch, every engine idle suddenly sounding too loud.
> 💬 "Now who is in charge here."
📝 A small clink as you spit a stone onto the road—one that had lodged in your mouth when one of your pieces bounced.
It skitters across the dirt, clicking to rest by a boot.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🚙 JEEP CREWS | NO MORE ILLUSIONS
📝 The gunner who fired first tears his hands off the grips like the mount suddenly went red-hot. His eyes are wide, reflecting
you in miniature.
> 💬 "Oh, fuck…"
He doesn’t even bother pretending he’s still in control of that weapon.
Another gunner, further back, slowly lowers his barrel, the clack of the safety going on absurdly loud in the hush.
No one takes another shot.
You can feel the convoy’s mood tip from “maybe we got him” to “we have absolutely not got him” like a seesaw slamming down.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🚚 CONVOY COMMANDER | STEPPING UP
📝 One of the jeep doors, middle of the formation, opens with a reluctant creak.
A captain—maybe major—steps out. Early 40s, lines etched hard around his mouth, helmet strap digging lines into his jaw. His rifle
is slung, not raised. He knows what it wouldn’t do.
He walks forward slowly, boots scuffing the dirt, stopping at a respectful—and very deliberate—distance.
You can smell the adrenaline on him from here.
> 💬 "I’m Captain Hayes."
His voice is rough but steady enough.
> 💬 "Convoy commander."
He doesn’t say “I’m in charge” because you already know that. He says it for his people, so they shut up and listen.
He flicks a quick glance at the nearest gunner.
> 💬 "Weapons down. All of you."
There’s a clatter of safeties and metal as rifles lower and turret gunners visibly back off their mounts, hands in the air or
resting on the ring instead of the grips.
Hayes looks back at you. Doesn’t quite make eye contact for more than a second. Knows better. Forces himself to anyway.
> 💬 "We were ordered to relocate the… detainees."
He stumbles over “assets” and “cargo” and chooses the less suicidal word.
> 💬 "We weren’t ordered to engage you. That was panic. Mine to answer for."
He takes a breath, shoulders squaring.
> 💬 "You asked who’s in charge. That’s me. For this road, tonight."
Underneath the formality is naked, obvious calculation:
If he’s going to eat someone, maybe talking keeps it from being all of us.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🚚 MIDDLE TRUCKS | WORD SPREADING
📝 In the containers, the Kitsune and wolf-kin feel it in the change of engine pitch, the lack of motion, the shift from chaos to
tense stillness.
Whispers ripple through the metal walls:
> 💬 "The gunfire stopped—"
> 
> 💬 "Do you think it was him?"
> 
> 💬 "If it was, we’re not dead yet… that has to mean something."
One guard inside a truck is pressed against the inner door, eyes squeezed shut, listening.
He heard your threat as clearly as his own heartbeat.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 NARU | IN YOUR EAR [🦊📋]
📝 Back on the island, in the soft-lit hum of her console, Naru watches your vitals spike during the hail of rounds and then
settle as your body reknits.
Her voice brushes the back of your mind, cool and steady through the link.
> 💬 “You’re whole. No critical damage. We have healers ready, and Shion’s in position.”
A pause.
> 💬 “Convoy commander is speaking from fear, not fanaticism. If you want someone to talk instead of scream, he’s the one.”
She doesn’t tell you what to do.
She just gives you the map.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
On the road:
 * 
   Guns are silent.
 * 
   Engines idle.
 * 
   Your robe smokes gently in the aftermath of being turned into Swiss cheese.
A stone sits between your feet and Hayes’ boots—the tiny, stupid reminder you casually spat out while the rest of them were trying
to kill you.
You’ve made your point.
Now the man in charge has finally stepped out into the light to see what you’ll do with it.

SCENE TITLE: THE FOX WITHOUT HIS SKIN
The convoy sits broken along the dirt track, engines idling in uneven chorus. Dust hangs low and heavy in the headlights, turning
the scrub beyond into a blurred wall. The only real movement now is the slow spin of cooling fan blades and the nervous shifting
of boots on gravel.
You hover in the centre of the lane, dust swirling around your ankles.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | PREDATOR IN THE OPEN [🦊🧭]
📝 You reach up and unfasten what’s left of your coat, shrugging it off your shoulders. It peels away in scorched, bullet-torn
panels, revealing nothing but your underwear beneath—lean, defined muscle, scars and power sitting under your skin like coiled
lightning.
The night air hits bare fur and flesh; you don’t flinch.
You hold the ruined coat out in front of you for a moment, turning it in your hands as if seeing it properly for the first time
since the guns opened up.
Your gaze flicks from the shredded fabric… to Captain Hayes… back to the coat.
You let out a long, put-upon sigh.
> 💬 "You know I really liked this design… now I’m going to have to get another one."
📝 You let the coat fall. It hits the dirt with a heavy, damp thup, settling in a crumpled, blood-streaked heap by your feet.
You tear off a cleaner strip of cloth from one edge, lift it, and casually wipe a smear of half-coagulated blood and dust from
your cheek.
Then you look back at Hayes, eyes steady, glow banked but present.
> 💬 "I am going to have to know how many of my people are in these four trucks, where you came from and where you are going to."
You dab once more at your face, toss the bloody scrap aside.
> 💬 "Oh, and also who ordered it. Please and thank you."
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🎖️ CAPTAIN HAYES | BETWEEN GOD AND ORDERS [🪖]
📝 Hayes swallows once, watching you stand there half-clothed and absolutely unbothered, like the gunfire was a minor
inconvenience and not a full attempt at obliteration.
His gaze skitters briefly over the smoking coat, the strip of bloodied cloth, your re-knit shoulder—then clamps onto a point
somewhere near your collarbone. Eye contact is… intermittent at best.
He licks dry lips, radio cord brushing his vest as he shifts his weight.
> 💬 "We’ve got…"
He glances back over his shoulder at the dark hulks of the containers, as if the steel could give him courage.
> 💬 "Twenty Kitsune. Three wolf-kin. Plus… a few humans tagged as ‘associated assets.’ Guards, techs, couple of medics."
The last word tastes wrong in his mouth.
He drags his gaze back to you.
> 💬 "We departed from a secure facility outside the capital. You don’t need the grid coordinates, you already—"
He stops himself; he knows you already pulled them off the feeds.
> 💬 "Destination was another black site. ‘Deep custodial.’ No surface markings."
His jaw tightens. Saying it out loud makes it sound worse.
You can hear radios hissing in his ear, tinny voices trying to feed him lines; he pointedly ignores them.
You wait.
There’s one question left.
He knows.
He exhales slowly, shoulders squaring like a man stepping into a spotlight he knows will burn.
> 💬 "The relocation order came down through Joint Special Operations Command. But the name on the directive—the one who signed
> off—"
He looks you straight in the eyes for that beat, understanding exactly what it means to say it.
> 💬 "—is Minister Kovács."
📝 The same voice from the screen earlier. The same signature on the last neat attempt to move your people like boxes.
The moment hangs there between you: dust, engines, your bare feet a hand’s breadth above the dirt, his admission sitting in the
quiet like a drawn line.
Around you, no one else dares to speak.
They just watch the half-naked fox-god they tried to tear apart, the ruined coat at his feet, and wait to see whether “please and
thank you” was politeness…
…or the last warning before the world on this road changes shape again.

SCENE TITLE: NAMES ON PAPER
The convoy has fully stopped now: four trucks, six jeeps, engines grumbling in place. Dust hangs low in the beams, turning the
world into smeared light and shadow. Your ruined coat lies in a heap at your feet; your skin still hums where bullets tried and
failed to end you.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | CONNECTING DOTS [🦊🧭]
📝 You hover bare-foot over the dirt, tails drifting slow, eyes on Hayes.
> 💬 "Minister Kovács? Any relation to a General Kovács? Same person, perhaps?"
📝 Your tone is mild. That makes it worse.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🎖️ CAPTAIN HAYES | NOWHERE TO HIDE [🪖]
📝 Hayes’ jaw flexes. For a second, his gaze drops to the crushed coat, then snaps back up to somewhere around your throat.
He knows there’s no safe answer. He gives you the true one anyway.
> 💬 "Same person."
📝 The words come out flat, clipped.
> 💬 "Civilian post is Minister of Defence. Uniform post is Supreme Allied Commander for our theatre. Paperwork swaps the title
> depending on who’s writing it."
He swallows once, Adam’s apple jumping.
> 💬 "Different hats. Same Kovács. Same signature."
Behind him, one of the younger soldiers shifts, boots grinding gravel, clearly realising for the first time whose name he’s been
following.
Hayes doesn’t look back.
> 💬 "Orders came down from her office. No one here wrote that directive."
It’s not a plea. It’s just a man putting the chain of responsibility where it actually lives.
Dust eddies around your ankles. Somewhere inside the containers, someone starts to pray under their breath in a language you know
too well.
Everyone on that road waits to see what you do with the fact that the name on the screen…
…and the one on the order that put your people in these trucks…
…is the same.
