SCENE TITLE: TERMS OF SURVIVAL
The air around you tightens.
Dust lifts from the ground not from wind, but from pressure. A low, almost subsonic hum creeps into the night, felt more in teeth
and bones than heard. The cracked dirt beneath your feet spreads outward in slow, spiderweb lines.
Headlights flicker.
Radios hiss and die.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | CONTROLLED FURY [🦊🔥]
📝 Your jaw locks hard enough to creak. You lift a fraction higher, your body haloed in a dull, contained blue glow—no flare, no
spectacle, just weight.
> 💬 "mother fucker…"
Each word lands separately, flat and cold.
> 💬 "All that talk about…"
You cut yourself off sharply, breath hissing through your teeth.
> 💬 "I knew I should have killed him."
📝 The ground cracks under you, a shallow ring fracturing outward like ice under pressure.
You fix Hayes with a stare that pins him in place.
> 💬 "Listen to me, and listen to me very carefully."
The glow intensifies—not brighter, just closer, like the air is compressing around you.
> 💬 "You are going to continue this convoy to its destination. You are then, on the way, going to call Kovács and tell him that
> there is an issue with one of the prisoners. They are showing signs of power and that he needs to come to that site
> immediately."
You don’t blink.
> 💬 "You will insist on it."
A beat.
> 💬 "I will ride in the back of the convoy with the prisoners."
📝 Your gaze hardens, the glow crawling faintly along the cracks in the dirt.
> 💬 "If you fuck up, you will all die."
Silence. No echo. No theatrics.
> 💬 "If you betray my plan, you will all die."
Another pause, deliberate.
> 💬 "If you do exactly as I say, I will mark this… incident as following orders and you will all see your families after and tell
> the story to your friends over a backyard BBQ."
You lean forward slightly in the air, enough that Hayes feels it.
> 💬 "Am I making myself very clear here?"
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🎖️ CAPTAIN HAYES | YES, SIR [🪖]
📝 Hayes doesn’t swallow. Doesn’t blink. He straightens instead—pure training kicking in when fear overloads.
> 💬 "Crystal."
One word. Immediate.
He raises a hand slowly, palm out—not surrender, acknowledgement—then taps his throat mic.
> 💬 "Convoy Actual to all units. Resume movement. Same destination. Weapons cold. No deviations."
Static, then clipped acknowledgements ripple back.
> 💬 "Actual copies. Weapons cold."
He looks back at you.
> 💬 "I’ll make the call. I’ll sell it hard."
A pause, careful but honest.
> 💬 "And I won’t fuck it up."
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🚙 CONVOY | OBEDIENCE RESTORED
📝 Engines rev back to life, controlled now. Trucks realign. Jeeps slot into formation with disciplined precision.
No guns are raised.
No one speaks more than necessary.
Every single soldier on that road understands one thing with perfect clarity:
They are no longer on a mission.
They are on probation.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🐺🦊 INSIDE THE CONTAINERS | SOMETHING CHANGES
📝 In the dark metal bellies of the trucks, the prisoners feel it—not the words, but the shift. The pressure eases just a
fraction. Fear gives way to a fragile, dangerous thing:
Hope.
Someone whispers your name.
Someone else grips the bars harder, like if they let go, this moment might slip away.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The convoy begins to roll.
Slow. Controlled. Obedient.
And this time—
You’re not flying beside it.
You’re going inside it.

SCENE TITLE: IN THE BELLY OF THE BEAST

The container wall ripples—not denting, not tearing—just giving way as if reality politely steps aside for you. Cold air rushes

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | AMONG THE CAGED [🦊🧭]

steady and reassuring rather than threatening.

📝 You don’t even look at them.

 * 
   Cuffs fall open.
 * 
   Collars click and drop dead.
 * 
   Energy binds gutter out like dying embers.

No one even breathes too loud.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
🦊 JAYSON | HOLDING THE LINE [🦊🧭]
📝 You stay where you are, between the captives and the armed men, an unmoving line drawn in living flesh and quiet power.
The truck keeps rolling.
Outside, the convoy believes it’s still in control.
Inside this container, everyone knows better.
For the first time in a long time, the cages are empty—not because someone took them away…
…but because they are no longer needed.
